loans.name: Bogue

texts.fr:
Bogue est une femme âgée de 33 ans. Elle est mariée å un  revendeur. Elle a 01 enfant de 04ans scolarisé.
Bogue travaille comme couturière et revendeuse de prêt à porter depuis 2007. Elle a un atelier afin de répondre à la demande de la clientèle.
Bogue a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes pour confectionner des habits. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Bogue voudrait agrandir son atelier. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Bogue is 33 years old and married to a reseller. She has a 4-year-old child who attends school. She has been working as a seamstress and retailer of ready-to-wear apparel since 2007. She works out of a sewing shop to better meet customer demand. 

Bogue is seeking her first loan from WAGES to buy pagnes (colorful West-African cloth) to make outfits. She wants to reinvest in her activity.

In the coming years, Bogue would like to expand her sewing shop. She plans to use the profits to ensure her family’s happiness.

loans.use: to buy pagnes to make outfits.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 48 years old and a business lady; she is married to Peter, a business man. They are blessed with three children. She has been running a green grocer business in an open air market for the past ten years with a monthly income of 8,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Lydia will use the loan to buy green vegetables and fruits for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to distribute the greens to the nearby schools and hospitals.

loans.use: to buy green vegetables and fruits for her business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past two years, Lydia has been working hard to manage her small business, which does stone quarrying. 

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials for the business, and will help Lydia to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Lydia hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Lydia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Lydia's future prospects by helping her to improve her business that has paid her school fees.

loans.use: to buy more materials for the business

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
This is Jacinta, 50, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Celestino, a steel man, and is a mother to her child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Jacinta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five peso's-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jacinta hopes her business grows more in the coming year and dreams of being able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nighty

texts.en:
Nighty lives in Yei. She is a food-stall seller and has been in business for three years. She is 25 years old, married, and has three children. One of them is still in school. 

Nighty heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of $500 in order to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes for sale

loans.name: Gereltod

texts.en: Gerelt-Od's cafeteria business was changed by the new business such as plumbing service. Now he needs some new plumbing equipment. Because his previous equipments have became old and works badly. The loan he is taking will be used to cover the cost of necessary plumbing equipments for his business.

loans.use: To cover the cost of necessary plumbing equipments for his business.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana tiene 35 años, está casada con Gregorio con quien tiene 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 4 de ellos. Toda esta familia vive en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Santa Clara, distrito de Huasahuasi – Tarma. Hace 20 años que Viviana se dedica a la agricultura. Su vida se centra en el cuidado de sus terrenos, ahí pasa la mayor parte del día. Sus principales cultivos son de papa en sus diferentes variedades. Con el carisma que la caracteriza en la comercialización, vende sus productos en el mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma; gracias a su buena disposición en el momento de la venta. Uno de sus principales problemas es la rancha que afecta sus cultivos, así también otras enfermedades, pero eso no la desanida y para más adelante quiere comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas y de esa manera minimizar costos de inversión. Sus hijos son su prioridad y destina la mayor parte de sus ingresos en sus estudios. Pero gracias al apoyo de su banco comunal; puede emprender no solo sus proyectos también brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Esta vez sembrará 40 sacos de semillas de papas, y para eso deberá invertir en el pago del arriendo de algunos terrenos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos unidos”, y este sería su crédito número 12 con MFP; donde agradece por todo este tiempo que; gracias al apoyo de su asociación. Pudo sembrar.
Viviana; iniciará otra siembra de papas, por eso, con el dinero del préstamo comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos. Además pagará el arriendo de sus terrenos y a los operarios quienes ayudarán en la siembra.
texts.en:
Viviana, age 35, is married to Gregorio.  They have five children, but only four of the children live with them.  The whole family lives in their own house in Sana Clara in the Huasahuasi-Tarma district.

Viviana has been farming for 20 years.  Her life centers around the care of her fields as that is where she spends the greater part of the day.  Her primary crops are different varieties of potatoes.  She is known for her charisma in marketing. She sells her products at the central market in the city of Tarma, thanks to her good disposition while making sales.

One of her main problems is the “rancha” (a type of fungus) that affects her crops.  There are also other diseases, but these do not discourage her.  Later she wants to buy her own fields for farming.  This would minimize her costs.

Her children are her priority, and the greater part of her income is for their education.  Thanks to the support of her communal bank, she can not only take on her projects, but she can also give her children a better quality of life.

This time she will plant 40 sacks of potato seeds.  To do so she will need to pay the rent for the land.

She belongs to the “Trabajemos Unidos” (Let’s Work Together) communal bank.  This will be her 12th loan with MFP, and she is grateful for all of this time.  Thanks to the support of her association she was able to plant.

Viviana will start another potato crop, and she will use the loan to buy organic fertilizer to spread on her crops.  She will also pay to rent the land, and she will pay workers to help with the planting.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer, rent land, and pay workers.

loans.name: Korto

texts.en:
Korto lives in Jacob Town. She is 20 years old and married with a child, age 4, that is in school and lives at home. Her husband is a social worker. 

For the past 2 years, Korto has been operating a shop in her community where she sells bread, cream, soap and others items. Since she lives in a large community and is the only one who has a shop, she is requesting a loan to purchase more bread, body cream, soap and others items for her business. 

She plans to build a house for her child.

loans.use: to purchase more bread, body cream, soap and others items for her business

loans.name: Tarsisio

texts.en: Tarsisio used the previous loan to buy materials for making baskets. With the income generated, he was able to pay school fees for his children and also provide other basics to the family. He has been dealing in the basket-making business for the last 11 years. His major hardships are high fuel and transportation costs and inadequate capital to meet the high demand. Tarsisio intends to use the loan to pay school fees and buy more materials for his business.

loans.use: to pay school fees and buy more materials for his business.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr: Moussa est un jeune chauffeur qui pratique cette activité depuis trois ans.Il lui a fallu auparavant, travailler comme apprenti chauffeur pendant 4 années pour obtenir son permis de conduire.Aujourd'hui il conduit un véhicule de transport interurbain. Les revenus qu'il parvient à obtenir lui permettent de prendre en charge ses propres besoins et de soutenir son père dans la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de la famille.Son véhicule étant malheureusement en panne, il sollicite un pret de 400 000f pour acheter un moteur. Son ambition est de développer son activité.
texts.en:
Moussa is a young driver who has been engaged in this activity for three years. He was a driver in training for 4 years prior to obtaining his license. 

He now drives a long distance transportation vehicle. The income earned allows him to support himself and to help his father with the household expenses. 

His vehicle broke down, which is why he is now seeking a loan of 400,000F to buy an engine. His goal is to expand his activity.

loans.use: to buy a replacement engine for his transportation vehicle.

loans.name: Alida

texts.es:
Alida de 24 años convive con Percy con quien tiene 3 hijos: María Fernanda de 5, Edith de 4 y Yamile de 1 año. Toda esta familia vive en una casa propia en la localidad de Patay, distrito de Palca – Tarma.
Alida es una joven madre de carácter fuerte y perseverante, de esa manera puede dedicarse con esmero a la agricultura. Siembra arvejas, maíz, papas, y flores. Las arvejas le brindan buenos ingresos por sus precios estables, mientras que los gladiolos son más rentables por su poca inversión y por su cosecha rápida. “Siembro 2 veces al año y trato que las cosechas coincidan con los meses donde el precio sube”, comenta orgullosa se su pericia.
La producción de papas, maíz y arvejas las vende  en el mercado mayorista de Tarma.
Mientras que los gladiolos los negocio en la ciudad de Lima, ahí sus precios son más altos. Para ello invierte en el servicio de fletes, pero que recupera con sus exitosas ventas.
Con el tiempo espera adquirir un carro de segunda mano, para trasladarse desde su localidad con mayor facilidad y para trasladar sus productos. Este sería su préstamo número 7 que obtendría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal: ”Los Picaflores de Patay”, menciona que el agrada estar rodeada de compañeros responsables y trabajadores.
Invertirá el dinero de su crédito en la compra de semillas de arvejas y bolsas de abonos para esparcirlos tanto para las arvejas como para las flores de gladiolos.
texts.en:
24-year old Alida lives with Percy and their three children: María Fernanda aged 5, Edith aged 4 and Yamile aged 1. They live in their own home located in Patay in Palca District, Tarma. 

Alida is a young mother with a strong and determined character which has enabled her to be a good farmer. She grows peas, maize, potatoes, and flowers. Peas bring in a good income as prices are stable, while gladioli are more profitable as they require very little investment and grow quickly. “I sow seeds twice a year and try to have the harvest coincide with a time when prices are high,” says Alida, proud of her skills.

The potatoes, maize, and peas are sold in Tarma’s wholesale market, whereas the gladioli are sold in Lima where prices are higher.  She pays for them to be transported to Lima but the cost is offset by successful sales. As time passes, she hopes to get a secondhand vehicle to transport the flowers and produce more easily.

This would be Alida’s seventh loan with MFP. She promises to make the monthly repayments punctually. She belongs to The Picaflores de Patay Community Bank and is happy to be surrounded by responsible and hardworking companions. Alida plans to use the loan to buy pea seeds and sacks of manure to spread both on the peas and on the gladioli.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and sacks of manure

loans.name: Mujeres Adelante (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúnen los 2 socios y las 17 socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Adelante, este es un grupo de personas que se dedican a diversas actividades para mejorar su calidad de vida, se dedican al comercio, venta de comida entre otras actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Narcisa, tiene 45 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya mayores de edad y el menor de 10 años que  estudian en escuela. El marido se dedica a la agricultura. 

Ella es una muy buena madre y esposa que para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar hace varios años y con lo poco que tenía adecuo un lugar en su casa  y puso una tienda de comestible,  con la cual puede salir adelante ya que su esposo gana muy poco en sus faenas del campo.  Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando están desocupados, tiene ya diez años con su negocio y gracias a esto ha podido solventar los estudios de sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta y está muy a gusto con el grupo ya que es un grupo muy responsable.
 
Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio y que crezca cada día más.   

Las dos fotos pequeñas son de dos socias que por motivos de trabajo no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 2 men and 17 women who make up the 'Mujeres Adelante' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo.  This is a group of people who work in different business activities in order to improve their quality of life.  They work in commerce, food sales and other activities.

One of the members of this group is Narcisa.  She is 45 years old, lives with her common-law husband, and has four children.  Three of her children are adults and her youngest is 10 years old and in school.  Her husband works in agriculture.

Narcisa is a very good mother and wife.  In order to help her husband with their household expenses she set aside a space in her house several years ago and, using the little money she had, she started a grocery store.  This has enabled her to provide for the family as her husband earns very little from his agricultural work.  Narcisa works every day, from 6.00am to 8.00pm, and sometimes until later.  Her husband and son help her in her work when they have any free time.  She has been in this business for ten years and it has enabled her to pay for her children's education.

Narcisa will use this loan to further stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cold meats and other essentials.  She has been a member of her community bank from the beginning and she is its president.  She is very happy with her group because it is a very responsible group.

Narcisa's goal is to continue in her business and to grow it further.

The two small photos are of two members who, for work reasons, could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cold meats and other essentials

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a 44-year-old business lady. She is a single mother of two children, ages 23 and 18 years, respectively. Hannah has been selling fruits for the past 3 years, with a monthly income of 5,000 KES which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Hannah will use the loan to buy fresh fruits for her business. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to start a green grocer business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits for her business

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en:
Ganbat is a 50-year-old married man who lives with his wife and daughter in an outer ger district, which lacks basic infrastructure, of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. 

His daughter, Dariimaa, has been working as a head of “Scholarship Education” training center since 2008. Her training center’s mission is to create opportunities and to place students on scholarship programs. The center also manages foreign language training. 

Previously, a Kiva loan was requested by Dariimaa , but now her father, Ganbat, wants to support to his daughter’s business in order to republish her book's third edition again. So Ganbat is requesting 2,500,000 Mongolian Turgriks (MNT) to publish his daughter book about scholarship programs for teenagers. Currently they rent an office building. Furthermore, they want to improve Ganbat’s daughter’s business and to own just their office room.

loans.use: to publish his daughter's book

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
Nely de 33 años, es madre soltera con 2 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de Pichari. Nely es una joven que desde muy niña paso muchas dificultades como el abandono de su padre quien lo dejó cuando tenía 7 años. Es así que creció junto a su madre, quien la educo y ahora se dedica al expendio de abarrotes en su tienda.
Cuenta que gracias a su tío quien la apoyo bastante con la finalidad de que su sobrina se dedicase a algo mejor; le dio un pequeño capital para emprender un negocio, fue así que abrió su propia tienda de abarrotes. Al comienzo lo hizo en una tienda alquilada hasta que logró un día construir su propia vivienda, en donde ahora esta ubicado su negocio. 
Nely esta tan contenta con su negocio por que percibe buenos ingresos si sacrificarse tanto, solo tiene que ser amable y vender sus productos a un precio justo. En un futuro Nely esta pensando abrir una tienda de venta de ropa, porque vio una buena oportunidad a este negocio.  Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Nely esta contenta con su banco comunal por que son personas solidarias y unidas.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles invertirá en el incremento de su mercadería.
texts.en:
Nely is 33 years old and a single mother with two children. They live together in their own home in the District of Pichari. Nely is a young woman who has endured many difficulties since she was girl. Her father abandoned her when she was seven years old. Nely was raised by her mother, who provided her with an education. Now she spends her time selling at her grocery store.

Nely expresses her thanks to her uncle for his support. He knew that his niece could be something better, so he gave her a small amount of capital so that she could start her business. This is how Nely opened her own grocery store. She began in a rented space, but she eventually was able to build her own shop where her business is now located.

Nelly is pleased that her business generates good income if she is willing to make sacrifices, be friendly, and sell products at a fair price. In the future, Nelly plans to open a clothing store because she sees this as a good business opportunity. This is her second loan with MFP and she promises to submit her payments. Nely is pleased with her Communal Bank because the members are supportive and unified. Her loan of 1000 PEN will be invested in additional merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to restock her store.

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en:
Loyce lives in Yei. She is a food stall vendor, and has been in business for 3 years. She is 50 years old, married, and has six children, three of them are still in school. 

Loyce heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Laure

texts.fr:
Laure est une femme âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée å un  agent de santé. Elle a 02 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier a 12 ans et le dernier a 03 ans.  
Laure travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale  depuis 2004. Elle vend  à toutes personnes dans une boutique.
Laure a requis son 1er crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale.. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Laure voudrait rendre l’activité durable et plus productive. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit de s’occuper de l’avenir des enfants.
texts.en:
Laure is a 41 year old woman.  She is married to a healthcare worker.  She has two children, one of whom attends school. The oldest is 12 and the youngest is 3.

Laure has been selling grocery products since 2004.  She makes her sales to the general public from a shop. 

Laure received her first loan throught WAGES in order to buy grocery products. She wants to reinvest in her business. 

In the years to come, Laure would like to make her business more productive. She says that with the profits, she will be able to offer her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
In the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province most of the inhabitants depend on agriculture to earn their livelihoods. The common agricultural businesses are crop farming, animal husbandry, and fishing. Among them, Chuon, age 56, has been working related to the rice-planting business alongside her spouse. With the many experiences she’s gained from this project, Chuon is able to manage her performance well and she could generate a plentiful harvest from her fertile land. Presently, she has been blessed with six children, three of whom are married.

As shown in the photo, Chuon’s house is becoming too old and most of its parts are broken. That leads her family into a hard living situation. Chuon wants to rebuild this house again with her savings, but it won’t be enough for the entire expenses. Therefore, she is asking for this loan to buy construction supplies and hire workers for constructing her house. 

She is very happy and appreciates that lenders treat her family in a generous way.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and hire workers for constructing her house.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy de 32 años está casada con Teófilo con quién tiene 3 hijos: Morelia de 16, Aymer de 8 y Cristian de 4 años. Toda esta familia vive en una casa propia en el anexo de Patay, distrito de Palca – Tarma. Nancy es una mujer ejemplar. Como toda madre del campo tiene que distribuir su tiempo para atender a sus hijos y la agricultura.
Siembra arvejas, papas de la variedad “Única” y flores de gladiolos. “Cada 4 meses siembro 2 bolsas de semillas de arvejas, de las que cosecho 30 sacos”, menciona. Toda su producción la negocia en el mercado mayorista de Tarma.
Así también afirma que con la venta de los gladiolos obtiene más ingresos, por su gran demanda para las ciudades de Huancayo, Lima y La Merced. Las ventas de los gladiolos son más beneficiosas en los meses de mayo y noviembre.
Con el tiempo espera tener más dinero de sus ahorros para adquirir terrenos propios, para ya no pagar el arriendo. Éste sería su crédito número 7 que obtendría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “Los Picaflores de Patay”, es el nombre de su banco comunal y se siente satisfecha con el trabajo desplegado.
Invertirá el dinero de su crédito en la compra de 2 bolsas de semillas de arvejas con 1200 soles; lo restante lo destinará a la compra de bolsas de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
32-year-old Nancy is married to Teófilo and they have three children: 16-year-old Morelia, 8-year-old Aymer and 4-year-old Cristian.  The family live in their own home, in Patay, in Palca-Tarma district.  Nancy is an exemplary woman.  Like all mothers who live in the country, she has to divide her time between caring for her children and farming.

Nancy grows peas, 'Única' potatoes and gladioli.  "Every four months I sow two bags of pea seeds which produces a harvest of 30 sacks", she says.  She negotiates the sale of all her crops in the wholesale market in Tarma.

Nancy says that she makes more income from selling her gladioli because there is a lot of demand in the cities of Huancayo, Lima and La Merced.  Her gladioli sales are most profitable in the months of May and November.

Over time, Nancy hopes to have more money in her savings account so that she can acquire her own farmland and no longer have to pay rent.  This will be her seventh loan from MFP and she pledges to be punctual in making her repayments.  "Los Picaflores de Patay" is the name of her community bank and she feels happy with the work they do.

Nancy will invest her loan money in buying two bags of pea seeds for 1,200 soles.  She will use the rest to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
Margot de 32 años es una mujer casada. Vive con su esposo Elmer y sus 2 hijos: Kenler de 15 y Ángel de 4 años en una casa propia en la localidad Patay, distrito de Palca- Tarma. Margot es una mujer perseverante. Hace 3 años tuvo una mala experiencia. Su cosecha de papas fracasó debido a los bajos precios. Por eso ahora solo se dedica a la siembra de arvejas y flores de gladiolos, los cuales, desde sus primeros años como agricultura, siempre le dieron buenos resultados.
“He sembrado 1 bolsa y media de arvejas, las que cosecharé en mayo, obtendré 40 sacos”, comenta.
Así mismo produce gladiolos, en este caso sus compradores la visitan hasta sus chacras para negociar las ventas. Por su parte, Elmer es chofer y ofrece servicios de movilidad de las rutas Tarma – Cerro de Pasco – La Oroya.
De esa manera, Margot quiere ofrecerles a sus hijos educación, alimento y vestido decentes, para eso y adquirir otras cosas seguirá trabajando. Margot accedería a su préstamo número 7 de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “Los Picaflores de Patay”, es el nombre de su banco comunal, se siente contento de pertenecer a un grupo sólido de personas responsables.
Con el dinero del préstamo comprará bolsas de abonos orgánicos y una bolsa de semillas de arveja para su siembra del febrero.
texts.en:
32-year-old Margot is a married woman.  She lives with her husband, Elmer, and their two children: 15-year-old Kenler and 4-year-old Ángel.  They live in their own home, in the town of Patay, in Palca-Tarma district.

Margot is a persevering woman.  Three years ago she had a bad experience.  Her potato harvest failed as a result of low prices.  Now she only grows peas and gladioli which, since she first started farming, have always given her good results.  "I have sown one and a half bags of peas and, when I harvest them in May, I will get 40 sacks from them", she says.  Margot also grows gladioli and her buyers come to her farm to visit her and negotiate their sale.  Her husband Elmer works as a driver and offers a transport service on the Tarma - Cerro de Pasco - La Oroya routes.

Margot would like to offer her children an education, food and decent clothes.  In order to achieve this and in order to acquire other things, she will continue working.

This will be Margot's 7th loan from MFP and she pledges to be punctual in making her monthly repayments.  "Los Picaflores de Patay" is the name of her community bank and she feels happy to belong to a solid group of responsible people.  Margot will use her loan money to buy bags of organic fertilizer and one bag of pea seeds which she will sow in February.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer and a bag of pea seeds

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora de 45 años está casada con Percy. Ella y su esposo viven juntos en una casa propia en la localidad de Patay, distrito Palca- Tarma. Nora esta contenta con su trabajo, ella se dedica a la agricultura sembrando papas, arvejas, flor, habas y zanahorias. “Siembro de todo para tener  dinero en todos los meses del año”, menciona. El duro trabajo y algunos problemas que tuvo que pasar por culpa del clima, le enseñaron a tener cuidado en las fechas se sembríos para que sus frutos broten sin dificultad. 
Nora negocia sus productos con inteligencia, para ello ya tiene compradores conocidos quienes llevan su producción para diferentes ciudades del país. Nora está orgullosa, por que todo lo que obtiene es por su esfuerzo y perseverancia. Gracias a su esposo  sus cultivos no están descuidados, quien  también trabaja en una institución estatal.
Nora quiere aumentar su producción, para ello arrendará otros terrenos en su propia localidad. Este sería su crédito número 7 que recibiría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Picaflores de Patay”, se siente contenta de ser parte de un grupo sólido y responsable.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de abonos orgánicos y sacos de guano de corral para sembrar papas de la variedad “Amarilis”.
texts.en:
45-year-old Nora is married to Percy.  She and her husband live together in their own home, in the town of Patay, in Palca-Tarma district.  Nora is happy with her work.  She is a farmer and grows potatoes, peas, flowers, beans and carrots.  "I grow a bit of everything so that I have money every month of the year", she says.  The hard work and also some problems that she had to deal with as a result of the weather taught her to be careful during sowing season and ensure that her crops sprout without difficulty.  

Nora negotiates the sale of her produce wisely.  She already has existing buyers who take her produce to different towns around the country.  Nora is proud because everything that she obtains is down to her hard work and perseverance.  Thanks to her husband, her crops are not neglected.  Her husband also works for a state institution.

Nora would like to increase her production and so she will rent more land in her own town.  This will be her 7th loan from MFP and she pledges to be punctual in making her monthly repayments.  She belongs to 'Los Picaflores de Patay' community bank and feels happy to belong to such a solid and responsible group.  Nora will invest her money in buying organic fertilizer and sacks of guano from farmyard birds which she will use when she sows her 'Amarilis' potatoes.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Ela Magdalena

texts.es:
Ela tiene 25 años de edad, es casada hace un año, y vive con su esposo en la aldea Carbónales, Bonito Oriental, Colon.
Ela hace 8 meses logro establecer un negocio de venta de plásticos, sandalias para dama y caballeros. El cual obtuvo con esfuerzos propios, adicionando también a su negocio la venta de carne de res, pollo, cerdo y venta de verdura.  Su negocio lo tiene establecido en un local del mercado. En el cual vende todo el día. 
Ella decidió solicitar un préstamo de 15,000 lempiras para invertir con más producto su negocio en la compra de verduras, carnes y plásticos.
Su meta es hacer crecer más su negocio y tener una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ela is 25 years old and has been married for one year. She lives with her husband in the neighborhood of Carbónales in Bonito Oriental, Colon. Eight months ago, Ela started a business selling plastics and sandals for women and men. Through her own efforts, she added another business selling beef, chicken, pork, and vegetables. This business is located at a space in the market where she sells all day.

Ela decided to ask for a loan of 15,000 HNL to invest in more products to sell in her businesses such as vegetables, meat, and plastic goods. Her goal is to grow her business and to have financial stability.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, and plastic goods to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora de 31 años, convive con Elvis, con quien tiene 2 hijos: Pamela de 12 y Geyson de 10 años. Toda esta familia vive en una casa propia en la localidad de Patay, distrito de Palca. Floria se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arvejas y papas  de la variedad “Yungay”, pero afirma que el conviene sembrar arvejas, por sus precios altos y por cosecharse 2 ó 3 veces al año.
“Normalmente siembro 3 bolsas de semillas. De una bolsa cosecho 30 sacos.”, menciona.
Por su  parte, Elvis trabaja en la mina, aportando otros ingresos para su familia. Y cuando cesan sus labores en esa empresa, dedica su tiempo a cultivar la tierra.
Floria está contenta con sus labores en el campo, por que le agrada su labor, a pesar de ser muy cansado y riesgoso.
Toda su producción la vente al instante. Para eso ya cuenta con compradores en la ciudad de Tarma.
Una de sus metas es adquirir otros terrenos para ampliar sus cosechas y para sembrar flores de gladiolos, cuyas ventas, son rentables. Éste sería su préstamo número 7 que obtendría de MFP, gracias a su ayuda, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en los pagos de las cuotas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Picaflores de Patay”, es un grupo unido y trabajador, ella está contenta de ser parte de él.
Con el dinero podrá comprar 2 bolsas de semillas de arvejas y 8 bolsas de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
31-year old Flora lives with Elvis and their two children: Pamela aged 12 and Geyson aged 10. They live in their own home located in Patay in Palca District, Tarma. Flora is a farmer and grows peas and Yungay potatoes. She explains that peas are better because of their high prices and because they can be harvested two or three times a year. “Normally I plant three bags of seeds. From one bag I get thirty sacks of peas,” she explains.

Elvis works at the mine and brings in another wage to support the family. When he’s finished his work there, he also works in the fields.

Flora enjoys her work although it is tiring and risky. The produce is sold as soon as it is harvested to buyers in the town of Tarma.

One of Flora’s goals is to buy more land and sow gladioli as growing flowers is a profitable business. This would be Flora’s seventh loan with MFP, and she is thankful for the support. She promises to make the repayments punctually. She belongs to The Picaflores de Patay Community Bank which is composed of united and hardworking members. Alida will be able to buy two bags of pea seeds and eight sacks of fertilizer with the loan.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds and eight sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Sida

texts.en: Sida, 40, is married and lives with her husband, two children and a brother in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have worked in the agricultural business for more than 10 years, and have extensive experience and considerable success in this career. They also raise cattle to sell. In order to improve her family's life, Sida is requesting for a loan for USD 1,000 to buy a car that her brother can use as taxi to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to have enough money to buy more cattle to sell for a profit and support her children's education through the Bachelor's degree. She also hopes to rebuild her house to make it much stronger so that her family can enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car that her brother can use as a taxi to generate more income.

loans.name: Ngor

texts.fr: Ngor est un homme marié.Il est père de 8 enfants dont 2 vont à l'école.Depuis plusieurs années, il pratique l'embouche ovine.Il achète des moutons  dans les marchés hebdomadaires de la région , les engraisse et les revend 6 mois plus tard. L'activité s'avère très rentable et lui rapporte des bénéfices qui lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille. Pour démarrer une nouvelle opération, il sollicite un pret de 200000f afin d'acheter 7 moutons.Son ambition est dépasser plus tard à l'embouche bovine.
texts.en: Ngor is a married man.  He is the father of eight children, two of whom attend school.  He has been raising sheep for several years.  He buys his sheep at the weekly markets in the region, fattens them up, then resells them six months later.  This work proves to be quite profitable and brings in an income which allows him to meet his family's needs.  In order to start a new operation, he is requesting a loan of 200,000 f to buy 7 sheep.  His goal is to switch to raising cattle later on.

loans.use: to buy seven sheep.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Lucrecia es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus 5 hijos dependientes, vive en un caserío rural de nombre “Paredones Alto” ubicado a unos a unos 10 minutos del distrito de Morrope el cual pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y esta a unas 2 horas aproximadamente, los pobladores de la zona en la que vive se dedican netamente a la agricultura, ganadería , artesanía entre otros, son caseríos rurales que están en vías de su desarrollo por lo que aun no cuentan con servicios básicos.


Lucrecia se dedica de manera diaria a la crianza y posterior comercialización de aves de corral en especial pavos, en la actualidad cuenta con una gran cantidad de aves los cuales ha criado y engordado con gran esfuerzo, para lo que ha podido instalar en su propia casa espacios estratégicos para la crianza de los mismos, la unión con su esposo y sus hijos ha hecho que emprendan en nuevos objetivos familiares y es que por eso trabajan diariamente para lograrlos y así mejorar su condición de vida, su esposo de manera interdiaria trabaja en un molino del mismo caserío ayudando de esa manera a la canasta familiar.

La casa de Lucrecia esta en malas condiciones debido a las constantes lluvias y por eso ha decidido solicitar un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1500 Nuevos Soles, para la compra de materiales de construcción con los que pueda reparar las partes deterioradas y así conservar la buena salud y los cuidados correspondientes de su familia 

Lucrecia  y su esposo y sus hijos son personas trabajadoras, amables y muy respetadas por sus vecinos de la zona en la que viven, derechos que se lo han ganado en base a su esfuerzo y dedicación al trabajo.
texts.en:
Lucrecia is a 35-year-old mother who lives in her own home together with her husband and five dependent children.  They live in a rural village called 'Paredones Alto' which is located some 10 minutes from Morrope district, in Lambayeque province.  The people in this area mainly farm, raise livestock and make handicrafts.  They live in developing, rural villages which do not receive basic services.

Lucrecia spends every day raising farmyard birds, especially turkeys, which she later sells.  She has a large number of birds which she has worked hard to raise and fatten.  She has spaces on her property where she raises her animals.  Lucrecia works together with her husband and children, undertaking new family projects together.  They work every day to achieve their goals and thereby improve their living conditions.  Her husband works every other day in a mill in the village which gives the family extra help.

Lucrecia's home is in a bad state of repair owing to the constant rains and, for this reason, she has decided to request a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy building supplies which she will use to repair the worn parts and thereby maintain her family's good health.

Lucrecia, her husband and children are all hard-working, kind people who are very well respected by their neighbors.  They have earned this respect through their hard work and commitment to their work.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to improve her home

loans.name: Lidia Marina

texts.es:
Doña Lidia Marina tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dos de ellos ya están casados y viven independientes y dos que tienen 14 y 22 años de edad,  solo uno de ellos estudia, vive en la aldea Cuaca, Tocoa, Colon.
Doña Lidia desde hace 6 años tiene un negocio de venta de ropa de segunda mano y sandalias de mujer. Inicio este negocio con la necesidad de generar ingresos para su familia ya que ella es madre soltera y no cuenta con la ayuda del padre de sus hijos. Adicionalmente elabora choco bananos para la venta y así poder obtener otro ingreso extra. Dedicándole todo el día al negocio con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Ella ha obtenido préstamo con Odef el cual le ha ayudado mucho en la inversión del negocio, actualmente solicita su segundo préstamo de 5,000 lempiras para comprar mas producto como Ropa de segunda mano y sandalias.
Su meta es seguir trabajando para crecer en su negocio y sacar su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Doña Lidia Marina is 53 years old and a single mother with four children. Two of them are already married and live independently. The other two are 14 and 22 years old, one of whom is studying. Lidia lives in the neighborhood of Cuaca in Tocoa, Colon.

Six years ago, Doña Lidia started a business selling secondhand clothing and women's sandals. She started this business out of necessity because she needed to generate income for her family since she is a single mother and does not receive assistance from the father of her children. In addition, she sells chocolate-covered bananas to sell as an extra source of income. She spends all day at her business with the help of her children.

Lidia is obtaining a loan from ODEF, which will be a great help with investing in her business. She is currently asking for second loan in the amount of 5,000 HNL so that she can buy secondhand clothing and sandals. Her goal is to continue working so that she can grow her business and move her family forward.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing and sandals.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia lives in Yei. She is a charcoal seller and has been in business for four years. She is 48 years old, a widow, and has four children. None of them are still in school. 

Cicilia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy green vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 40 años, está casada con Fernando, con quien tiene 4 hijos. Ellos viven en una casa propia en el caserío de Santa Clara, distrito de Huasahuasi. Margarita es una mujer fuerte e inteligente. Hace 12 años se dedica a la agricultura. En sus terrenos de cultivo siembre papas y arvejas, en gran cantidad, las que después de cada cosecha lo comercializa en el mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma, pero en campañas agrícolas, viaja constantemente hacia la ciudad de Lima para comercializar su producción. Ahí obtiene mayores ganancias. Le gusta trabajar en el campo, a pesar del frío y lo cansado que suele resultar, y aunque existan pérdidas, ella afirma que todo depende de cómo se atienda o cuide sus plantaciones. Además tiene 5 vacas que cuida con mucha dedicación ya que le proporcionan leche, con lo que elabora quesos; que vende a los comerciantes minoristas que llevan el queso a las ferias que se realizan los días jueves y domingos en la ciudad de Tarma. En ambas actividades le va muy bien. Ahora una de sus prioridades es adquirir otros terrenos para sembrar más arvejas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos unidos”, y este es su crédito número 10 con MFP. Se siente contenta de formar parte de uno de los bancos comunales más sobresalientes de su distrito. 
Margarita, invertirá el dinero de su préstamo en la compra de bolsas de abonos orgánicos y 3 bolsas de semillas de arvejas.
texts.en:
Margarita, age 40, is married to Fernando, and they have four children.  They live in their own house in the rural community of Santa Clara in the Huasahuasi district.  Margarita is a strong and intelligent woman.

She has been farming for 12 years.  She grows potatoes and peas in large quantities.  After each harvest she sells them in the central market in the city of Tarma.  But during the agricultural seasons she travels constantly to the city of Lima in order to sell her production.  She gets greater income there.

She likes working in the fields in spite of the cold and how tired it usually makes her.  Even though there are losses, she asserts that everything depends upon how the plants are tended to or cared for.

She also has five cows that she cares for with great dedication because they supply milk.  She uses the milk to make cheese that she sells to small businessmen.  The small businessmen take the cheese to the city of Tarma fairs, which are held on Thursdays and Sundays.  Both business activities are going very well for her.  One of her priorities now is to acquire more land for planting peas.

She belongs to the “Trabajemos Unidos” (Let’s Work Together) communal bank.  This is her tenth loan with MFP.  She is happy to be part of one of the most outstanding communal banks in her district.

Margarita will use the loan to buy bags of organic fertilizer and three bags of pea seeds.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer and three bags of pea seeds.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 53 años de edad, está casado hace más de 32 años con Sra. Bernarda de 48 años de edad, tienen 5 hijos juntos, 2 en edad escolar y 3 hijos que  ya son mayores de edad y gracias a sus padres han logrado una profesión.
Hace 20 años empezó con una pequeña despensa en su domicilio, donde la Sra. atendía mientras él se dedicaba a comprar animales para faenarlos y luego vender la carne en la despensa. Actualmente se encuentra trabajando la familia junta, ya que es el centro de compra más importante y concurrida de la ciudad, gracias a este negocio han podido salir adelante y ayudarse los unos a los otros.
Ahora desea comprar más animales para faenarlos puesto que tiene muchas ventas en esta época, y es por ello que solicita el crédito. Esta muy agradecido por esta oportunidad de progreso que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Juan is 53 years old.  He has been married to 48-year-old Bernada for more than 32 years.  They have five children together.  Two of their children are school age and three are already adults and, thanks to their parents, have already become professionals.  

Twenty years ago, Juan set up a small grocery store in his home where his wife worked while he bought animals to slaughter and then sold their meat in the store.  The family is currently working together as theirs is the biggest and busiest shopping place in the town.  Thanks to this business, they have been able to support themselves and help each other out.

Juan would like to buy more animals to slaughter as he makes a lot of sales at this time of year.  This is why he is requesting a loan.  He is very grateful for this opportunity to make progress that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy a cow to slaughter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more commodities like sugar, salt, beans, bread, maize flour, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 44-year-old business lady. She is a single mother of one child, aged four years. She has been running a green grocer business in an open air market for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 8,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD, after being introduced to the lending agency by an existing KADET customer. Rose will use the loan to buy green vegetables and fruits for her business.

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. Her hope is to distribute greens to the nearby schools and hospitals.

loans.use: To buy green vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Asina

texts.en: Asina lives in the town of Yei, South Sudan. For the last four years, she has earned a living by selling food from a stall. She is 30 years old, married and has one child, who is enrolled in school. Asina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and has requested her second loan from our organization, for 700 SDG, to buy onions and beans. She will use her extra income made possible by this loan to pay her child's school fee.

loans.use: to buy beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Cerafina

texts.es:
La  Sra.  Cerafina  tiene 54 años de edad es madre soltera y cuenta que tiene 4 hijos, todos mayores, quienes la ayudan con los gastos que tiene.
Esta señora es muy sacrificada empezó trabajando como empleada domestica en casas particulares para poder estudiar y así se recibió de profesora y empezó a ejercer su profesión luego con la plata que ganaba monto una pequeña despensa donde su hijo también ya le ayuda, gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo brindarles a sus hijos todas las comodidades y a la vez hacerle estudiar.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos de primera necesidad como ser harina, fideo. Arroz, aceite y otros, agradece a por la oportunidad que le da kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Cerafina is 54 years old.  She is a single mother and has four children who are all adults and help her with her expenses.

Cerafina is a very selfless lady.  She started out working as a domestic employee in private homes so that she could study.  She became a teacher and started working in her profession.  Later, with the money she earned, she set up a small grocery store where her son helps her out.  Thanks to her work and efforts, she was able to provide her children with all the comforts they needed and an education.

Cerafina is requesting this loan to buy essentials such as flour, noodles, rice, oil, etc.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving from Kiva and  Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy flour, noodles, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
El  Sr. Esteban es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 28 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Estela de 33 años de edad, tienen 1 hijo aun pequeño, el cual es el motor de los dos y la razón de lucha de ambos.
El Sr. se dedica como vendedor ambulante artículos de mercerías y bijouterie, y nos dice que tiene una clientela bien formada, lo cual le ayuda a tener muy buen ingreso. El se define como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que se esfuerza al máximo para poder salir adelante y ayudar a su familia, y darle a su hijo un futuro sin privaciones ni limitaciones.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de artículos de mercería y bijouterie para que pueda abastecerse y tener más variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Esteban is from the city of Santaní.  He is 28 years old and married to Estela who is 33 years old.  The couple have one son who is still young.  He is their driving force and the reason they both work so hard.

Esteban works as an itinerant vendor of sewing supplies and costume jewelry.  He tells us that he has a well established customer base which helps him to make a very good income.  He describes himself as a very hard-working and tenacious person who works as hard as possible so that he can make progress, help his family and provide his son with a future free from hardship and limitations.

Esteban is requesting this loan to buy sewing supplies and costume jewelry so that he can stock his business and have available more variety to offer his customers.  He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that he is receiving as the loan will be very helpful.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and costume jewelry

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: El señor fernando vive en la provincia de Cercado, en el departamento de la cuidad de Cochabamba, es soltero, es uan persona muy trabajadora, vive con su madre y sus hermanos, la principal fuente de ingresos es el servicio de transporte de pasajeros que el realiza en la cuidad de Cochabamba, actualmente una construcción sin concluir de dos habitaciones. El requiere un prestamo para terminar de hacer construir sus habitaciones en su vivienda y asi poder dar mayor espacio y comodidad a su madre y hermanos. El agradece a KIVA por el apoyo del préstamo que le otorgan mediante la institución financiera CIDRE
texts.en:
Señor Fernando lives in the province of Cercado, in the department of the city of Cochabamba.  He is single, and is a very hard-working person.  He lives with his mother and his siblings.  His main source of income is providing passenger transportation service, which he does in the city of Cochabamba.

He currently has unfinished construction of two rooms.  He is requesting the loan to finish the construction of these rooms in his home, and so be able to provide better space and comfort for his mother and siblings.

He is grateful to Kiva for the support of this loan, which is being offered to him through the financial institution CIDRE.

loans.use: to finish building work in his home.

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Sek, age 27, has run a fish-selling business since 2004 in a local market in the Pouk district. She sells fish which are caught in the Tonle Sap River by her husband. Typically, she earns an average of $3.00 per day. She also owns a plot of land where she sells rice, but is not able to earn enough money to cover her daily expenses because she has two children who completely depend on her. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her rice farm. Although sometimes natural calamities destroy her crops, she has the strong commitment needed to ensure a good output from her farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her rice farm.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora de 44 años convive con su pareja con quien tiene 4 hijos de 24 años, 2 mellizas de 15 y su último de 8 años. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en la localidad de Kimiri, distrito de Chanchamayo. Desde que tiene 20 años, Dora trabaja coordinadamente en el campo. En parcelas que se ubican a varios minutos de su localidad cuenta con 2 cuadras de terrenos de cultivos, en ellos siembra café y plátanos. Con la ayuda de su esposo y su hijo mayor puede optimizar sus cuidados. Todo depende de cómo distribuyan su tiempo.
Por su parte su esposo se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte con un automóvil propio. Su ruta es de La Merced hasta el Puente Paucartambo. De lunes a sábados realiza este recorrido. De esa manera, tanto su esposo como ella aportan con ingresos económicos para mantener a sus 4 hijos, especialmente a las mellizas y al pequeño de 8 años, que aún se encuentran en la etapa escolar.
Dora ampliará su producción de café, para ello renovará algunas plantas de café que ya se están marchitando y dejando de generar granos. Sería al primera vez que Dora accedería a un préstamo de MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen”, y se siente contenta de tener compañeros que comparten los mismos intereses. De recibir el dinero, lo invertirá en la compra de 3000 plantitas de café para renovar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Dora is 44 years old and in a common-law relationship with her partner. They have four children: a 24-year-old, 15-year-old twins, and the youngest is 8 years old. Dora and her family live in their own home in the town of Kimiri in the District of Chanchamayo. She works in coordination on her farm. Dora grows coffee and bananas on two plots of land located several minutes away from town. With the help of her husband and oldest son, she is able to optimize the care she provides to her crops. Everything depends on how they manage their time.

Her husband also provides transportation services using his own automobile. His route stretches from La Merced to Puente Paucartambo. He travels Monday through Saturdays. In this manner, he is able to provide financial income to support their four children, especially the twins and the 8-year-old since they are of school age.

Dora wants to expand her production of coffee, so she will replace some of the plants that have withered with ones that will generate beans. This will be her first time to access a loan from MFP. For this reason, she takes responsibility of her monthly payments. Dora is part of the Communal Bank "Virgen del Carmen" and is pleased that she shares the same interests with her fellow members. Upon receipt of the money, she will invest in the purchase of 3000 coffee seedlings so that she can replace her crops.

loans.use: to buy 3,000 coffee plants.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 59 años de edad, está casada desde hace tiempo y vive en su propia casa de la ciudad de Encarnación.
La señora Constancia es comerciante desde hace tiempo, actualmente se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas, minutas y otros, tiene mucha clientela en la zona, además ahora está vendiendo también en la playa de San Isidro donde concurre mucha gente. Gracias a esto ha  podido salir adelante y mantener su hogar, con la ayuda de su marido quien también la ayuda con los gastos del día a día. Ella sueña con poder tener un local donde poder ofrecer las comidas que vende y es por ese sueño que siempre se esfuerza al máximo.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder titular un terreno que tiene, ya que este le servirá para su futuro negocio. Agradece por esta oportunidad de progreso que recibe, ya que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
María is 59 years old and has been married for years.  She lives in her own home in the city of Encarnación.

María has been a saleswoman for some years.  Her current business is making and selling meals, snacks, etc.  She has a lot of customers in the area.  She is also now making sales on the beach in San Isidro where there are a lot of people.  Thanks to all this, she has been able to provide for and support her household, with the help of her husband who also contributes towards their daily expenses.  María dreams of having premises where she can offer the food that she sells.  With this dream in mind, she always works as hard as she can.

María is requesting this loan so that she can gain the official title for a plot of land that she has as she plans to use it for her future business.  She is grateful for the opportunity to make progress that she is receiving.  The loan will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: to gain the official title for a plot of land on which she hopes to build future business premises

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar es un señor muy trabajador y responsable, nacido y criado en la ciudad de Paraguarí, hoy en día está casado, vive en casa propia con su esposa y tres de sus cinco hijos en la misma ciudad.
Cesar es lechero desde hace más de ocho años, había empezado con tan solo dos vacas, hoy en día gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ya cuenta con 16 cabezas de ganado entre ellos terneros vacas y toros de las cuales ordeña ocho vacas, todos los días de la semana a tempranas horas de la madrugada juntando más de 40 litros que distribuye a sus más de 25 clientes por toda la ciudad de Paraguarí.
Solicito el crédito para la compra de una vaca para así tratar de ampliar su clientela y generar más ingreso y satisfacer todas las necesidades de él y de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar is a very hard-working and responsible man.  He was born and raised in the city of Paraguarí, and is now married.  He lives in his own home in that same city with his wife and three of his five children.

Cesar has been working in dairy for more than eight years.  He began with only two cows, but today, thanks to his effort and dedication he has 16 head of cattle, including calves, cows, and bulls.  He has eight cows that he milks every day of the week at an early hour, delivering more than 40 liters which he distributes to over 25 clients throughout the city of Paraguarí.

He is requesting the loan or the purchase of a cow, so that he can expand his customer base and earn more income, and meet all the needs of himself and his entire family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Thav

texts.en: Thav, 36, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in an agricultural business for over 10 years. They have extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing agricultural crops and earn approximately $3 USD per day. Additionally, her husband works as a construction worker to generate extra income to support the family. He can earn approximately USD $5 USD per day. In order to expand her family’s income, Thav is requesting a loan of $500 USD to purchase cattle to breed in order to resell for a profitable price when they gain weight. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business to be a construction foreman, build a new house, and support her children in their studies until they get a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed and resell for a profitable price when they gain weight

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La Sra. Graciela es casada tiene 2 hijos, uno de 9 y 13 año, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y comenta que desde siempre ha trabajado y que por eso no teme a los desafíos ni a probar cosas nuevas.
Graciela es comerciante, realiza ventas de cotillón y confección de vestidos de 15 años, casamientos y demás tipos de acontecimientos. Nos dice que hace tres años que se dedica a esto y que por medio de este trabajo ha logrado salir adelante y ayudar a sus hijos a poder estudiar. Su mayor deseo es que sus hijos puedan ir a la universidad y de esa forma poder ser personas de bien.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas e hilos, con lo cual podrá seguir confeccionando las prendas que vende. Ella está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Graciela is married and has two children who are 9 and 13 years old.  She is a very hard-working person and comments that she has always worked.  For this reason, she does not fear challenges and is not afraid to try new things.

Graciela is a saleswoman.  She sells party favors and also makes clothing for 15th birthday celebrations, weddings and other types of events.  She tells us that she has been in this business for three years and, through this work, she has managed to get ahead and help her children study.  Her biggest wish is for her children to go to University and become upstanding citizens.

Graciela is requesting this loan to buy fabric and thread so that she can continue making the clothes that she sells.  She is very grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy fabric and threads

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 52 years old and an enterprising businesswoman who is also the single mother of five children. She has been selling potatoes in an open air market for the past 10 years, and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to our organization by an existing customer.  Margaret will use the loan to buy sacks of potatoes for her business. She will use the profits she expects to earn to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes for her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 37 years old and an enterprising businesswoman who is the single mother of one child. She has been selling chips (or french fries) for the past 10 years and earns an income of KES 10,000 a month, which she uses to meet her child’s basic needs. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to our organization by an existing KADET customer.  Ruth will use the loan to buy potatoes to make chips to sell to her customers. 
With the anticipated profit, she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to open a hotel.

loans.use: to buy potatoes to make into chips to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Philiph

texts.en:
Philiph is a 38-year-old man from Kilgoris and is married to Jesca. They have five children, ages 2, 6, 8, 10, and 13. He operates a motorcycle transport business, which he has been doing for the last two years. He makes a monthly profit of 15,000 Kenyan shillings. 

He has borrowed his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy motorbike spare parts and also to add stock in his retail shop.

His dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Geraldo

texts.es:
Don Geraldo  tiene 41 años de edad, está casado hace mas de 15 años,  tiene dos hijos, quienes ya son todos mayores de edad, con trabajo independiente.
El señor Geraldo es hijo de un agricultor, creció en una de las compañías de Carapeguá, trabajó en el campo con su padre, a los 26 años de edad se casó con la hija de una tejedora y  empezaron a trabajar juntos. Hoy en día   hace más de 15  años que se dedica en  las ventas de las tradicionales sobrecamas y hamacas que  lleva a vender por las zonas de Caaguazú y ciudad del Este con una  clientela bien  formada, incluso su señora quien es artesana le teje las frazadas y así le sale más barato. Gracias a este trabajo y al esfuerzo de los dos  pudo construir una linda casa para brindar a su familia una vida honrada y digna.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos y color para tejer hamacas que en ésta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes.
texts.en:
Geraldo is 41 years old and has been married for more than 15 years.  He has two children who are both now adults and have their own jobs.  

Geraldo is a farmer's son and grew up in Carapeguá.  He worked in the fields together with his father.  When he was 26 years old, he married a weaver's daughter and they started working together.  He has now been working for more than 15 years selling traditional bedspreads and hammocks which he sells in parts of Caaguazú and Ciudad del Este.  He has a well-established customer base.  His wife is a craftswoman and weaves blankets for him which work out cheaper.  Thanks to this work and their joint efforts, the couple were able to build a beautiful house where they provided their family with a decent life.

Geraldo is requesting this loan to buy threads and dyes for weaving hammocks as his customers request a lot of them during this season.

loans.use: to buy thread and dyes for weaving bedspreads and hammocks

loans.name: Vakhtang

texts.en:
Vakhtang requested a start-up loan within the framework of the Kiva start-up program. He is 45 years old, married, and lives with his family – his wife, Anna, and their 13-year-old daughter. Vakhtang works in a local brick factory as a worker. Anna is a housewife. Their daughter goes to school. 

Five years ago Vakhtang used to run a family dairy farm. He sold all his cows because of his father’s illness, as he needed money for covering the cost of treatment. Now the only income for the family is Vakhtang’s salary at the factory, 400 Laris per month. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the “subsistence poor” category. 

Vakhtang requested credit for purchasing calves. He will raise them and sell grown calves in October for a higher price. The family will get additional income. Vakhtang plans to reinvest 50% of the earned income in the same business, as the rest of the profit will be used for improving family members’ living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 38 years old and married to Jane. They are blessed with five children, ages 14, 9, 7, 5 and 1. He owns a posho mill (for grinding wheat or maize), which he bought three years ago. He earns a monthly income of 9,000 KES. 

He is requesting a loan of 22,500 KES to buy bags of maize for sale. The anticipated profit will help him pay his children's school fees. He hopes to expand his business to greater levels.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Mawatta

texts.en: Mawatta lives in Jacobs Town. She is 37 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of five months and 12 years. Her husband is a business man. For the past four years she has been selling palm oil in the local market. She enjoys when customers buy from her and she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. In the future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia lives in Yei. She is a food stall seller and has been in business for three years. She is 45 years old, married, and has five children. Three of them are still in school. 

Cicilia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale

loans.name: Maria Rene

texts.es: Maria Rene es una profesora que vive en el departamento de Cochabamba, en la provincia de Quillacollo, trabaja muy duro para mantener a su familia, vive con su padre que es mayor de edad, y sus hermanos, ella trabaja en la provincia del Tapacari en un escuela del Gobierno, pero solo trabaja media semana, los restantes dias de la semana, Maria Rene lo dedica a la atención de un pequeño Billar que cuenta con 4 mesas que tiene su padre que por la edad y vejez ya no puede administrarlo, ella necesita abrir y atender ese salon ya que su sueldo no alcanza para mantener a sus 4 hermanos menores. Ahora ella solicita el prestamo que KIVA ofrece para comprar se una motocicleta que le permita moverse al trabajo y tambien para atender el salón de Billar. Ella agradece el opoyo que brinda KIVA a su persona por brindarle este servicio.
texts.en:
Maria Rene is a teacher who lives in the Department of Cochabamba in Quillacollo Province. She works very hard to support her family. Maria Rene lives with her elderly father and her siblings. She works at a government school in Tapacari Province, but only on a part-time basis. On the other days of the week, Maria Rene manages a small billiard hall that she took over four months ago because her elderly father who is retired is no longer able to look after it. She needs to manage this business and keep it open because her salary is not enough to support her four younger siblings.

Maria Rene is now requesting a Kiva loan so that she can buy a motorcycle that will enable her to travel to work and to her billiard hall so that she can manage it. She is grateful for the support provided by Kiva and to everyone who helps to offer this service.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es:
Nerida de 34 años es una mujer casada. Manuel su esposo y sus 2 hijos: Karelyn de 16 y Arnol de 9 años, son su tesoro más preciado. Todos viven juntos en una casa propia en la localidad de Patay, distrito de Palca – Tarma. Nerida es una mujer que le agrada el trabajo del campo. Hace 15 años labora en terrenos de su propiedad y en otros que arrienda. 
“Siembro arvejas, papas y gladiolos”, comenta, añadiendo que es más rentable la cosecha de gladiolos, ya que cada paquete lo vende a 70 soles.
Por su parte, Manuel trabaja brindando servicio de transporte interprovincial en su carro propio. Su ruta es de Tarma hacia Cerro de Pasco- Carhuamayo y viceversa. Manifiesta que es una de los recorridos de más demanda y de buen pago. Cobra 25 soles por pasajero y en cada viaja traslada 4 pasajeros. Le va bien en esta actividad.
Nerida no descuida sus sembríos y cada vez siembra un poco más. De esta manera piensa adquirir otras parcelas en otros distritos para producir hortalizas. Éste sería su préstamo número 7 que obtendría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “los Picaflores de Patay” y se siente contenta de pertenecer a un grupo sólido de personas solidarias.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de 2 bolsas de semillas de arvejas y varios sacos de abonos para iniciar una siembra para julio.
texts.en:
Nerida is 34 years old and is married to Manuel, with whom she has two children: Karelyn, who is 16 years old, and Arnol who is 9 years old. Her children are her most precious treasures. The family lives together in their own home which is located in Patay, in the district of Palca - Tarma. 

Nerida enjoys working in the fields farming. For 15 years she has farmed her own land as well as land that she rents. "I plant peas, potatoes, and gladiolas." she said. She also added that the gladiolas are more profitable, as she can sell them for 70 soles (about $25) a package.   

Meanwhile Manuel works providing transportation service within the province in his own car. His route goes from Tarma to Cerro de Pasco - Carhuamayo and vice versa. He explained that this is one of the busiest routes, with highest demand for transportation services and good pay. He does well with this business. 

Nerida does not neglect her crops and each time she plants a little more. She is considering renting other plots of land in other districts so she can plant vegetables. This is the 7th loan that she has gotten through MFP. She promises to make her payments punctually. She is a member of the communal bank "Los Picaflores de Patay" (The Hummingbirds of Patay) and she is happy to be a part of this strong group of united people. She will invest the money in two bags of pea seeds and various sacks of fertilizer to start a new crop in July.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Yean

texts.en:
Yean was born in the year 1981. She is married and has a lovely child attending a local school in Pouk district, Siem Reap province. Her family's primary business is fattening up and selling pigs. She raises them both for meat and offspring. After her pigs are big enough to sell, her husband transports them to sell in the marketplaces of the province. From this type of business, she is able to generate an income of $5.00 per day. 

In order to further increase and develop her business, Yean is requesting a loan in the amount of KHR 4,000,000 to purchase feed and an additional hog to raise. She always dreams of having a comfortable living one day.

loans.use: to purchase feed and an additional hog to raise.

loans.name: Sours

texts.en:
Sours, 26, is the mother of a lovely young kid. She lives in Dongkor commune, a distant area of Phnom Penh. She is a garment-factory worker. Usually, she earns her payment monthly as salary. She is very industrious in sewing clothes at her workplace because she wants to save money for her child’s education in the future. As a result, she works overtime around 10 hours per day to get more bonus payment. 

Presently, Sours is experiencing difficulty in transportation because there is not a suitable vehicle for use in her family. So she is now seeking a loan of $700 to purchase a secondhand motorcycle, which she will use for commuting to her workplace without paying for taxi service any longer. In her view, this loan is very useful for her family. She hopes that her living conditions will improve through using the loan given by Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and maize meal

loans.name: Mirna Maria

texts.es:
La señora Mirna María, es madre soltera con 3 hijos menores a su cargo los cuales ha logrado educar y criar por si sola, inicia su día laborar a las 7:00 am finalizándolo a las 5:00 pm. Inicio su negocio ambulante vendiendo bolsas plásticas con un capital de C$ 2,000.00 producto de sus ahorros, anteriormente viajaba a Guatemala a comprar ropa al por mayor.

El crédito lo utiliza para la compra de Bolsas plásticas, Plástico Oscuro, Platos, Vasos, Cucharas, Tazas desechables, etc. etc.,  así lograr obtener mejores ganancias y mejorar la calidad de vida para ella y sus hijos.

La señora Mirna está muy agradecida con ceprodel ya que le ha ayudado a crecer su inventario logrando incrementar tanto sus ganancias como su clientela y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mirna María is a single mother with three minor children in her care, whom she has managed to raise and educate on her own. She begins her work day at 7:00am, and finishes at 5:00pm. She started her business as a street vendor selling plastic bags, with 2,000 cordobas in working capital that she had saved. Previously she used to travel to Guatemala to buy clothing at wholesale.

She is using the loan to buy plastic bags, dark plastic, plates, glasses, spoons, disposable cups etc.  In this way she will manage to obtain better earnings and improve the quality of life for her and her children.

Mirna is very thankful to Ceprodel, as it has helped her add to her inventory; and succeed in increasing both her earnings and her clientele, as well as her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy plastic bags, dark plastic, plates, glasses, spoons, disposable cups, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past five years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and soap for resale, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to own a wholesale business. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.
