texts.en: Rose is 31 years old and married with three children. She sells paraffin to earn a living. She has been in the business for one year and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy paraffin to sell.

loans.use: To buy paraffin to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy film and albums.

loans.name: Abertha

texts.en: Abertha lives in Jacob Town. She is 44 years old, married, and her husband is a security guard. They have two children aged 6 and 29 years old. For the past thirty years she has been selling palm oil in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more  palm oil for her business. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more  palm oil for her business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 47 years old. An enterprising business lady, she is widowed with three children. She has been selling potatoes in an open-air market for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.


She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  Susan will use the loan to buy sacks of potatoes for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes for her business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives in Malindi, Kenya. He is a married man and owns a tailoring shop which has been running for seven years. He first worked as a coral miner and obtained the startup capital from that venture. Besides this, Samuel also sells fresh juices to the residents around his business.

Samuel is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase clothing materials. He plans to purchase more sewing machines from the extra income from this loan. 

His challenges include inflation, the high cost of materials and licensing fees. He has witnessed the business grow and would like to open a design shop in future.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: L’emprunteur s’appelle Fatoumata, célibataire, âgée de 26 ans, qui fait de la vente d’habits et de chaussures depuis  4 ans. Elle se ravitaille à Dakar et revend sa marchandise dans le quartier ou elle habite et ou elle compte la plupart de ses clients. Fatoumata n’a pas de charges car elle  vit chez son père qui  travaille toujours et gère sa famille. Ce qu’elle a comme recette ; elle le réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The borrower is named Fatoumata; she is single, 26 years old and has been selling outfits and shoes for four years. She obtains her supplies in Dakar and sells her merchandise in the neighborhood where she lives and where she sees the majority of her clients.

Fatoumata has no expenses as she lives with her father, who is still working and oversees the family. What she receives in the way of revenue, she reinvests in her business.

loans.use: To purchase outfits and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 31 years old and a business lady. She is married to John, a farmer. They are blessed with one child aged three years. Naomi has been running a beauty salon for the past five years with the monthly income of KES 6,000 which she uses to support her family.


She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  Naomi will use the loan to buy beauty products for her business. 


With the anticipated profit from the salon business, she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to add cosmetics to her salon.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is 40 years old and married with two children. He runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.fr:
Nicolas est un homme âgé de 54 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a cinq enfants, dont quatre à l’école. Le premier a trente ans et le dernier a quinze ans.
Nicolas travaille comme revendeur depuis 2007. Il vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour les ménages dans sa boutique. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Nicolas a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Nicolas voudrait agrandir la taille de l’activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Nicolas is a 54-year-old man. He is married to a retailer. He has five children, four of whom attend school. The eldest is 30 years old and the youngest is 15.

Nicolas has worked as a retailer since 2007. He sells general household foodstuffs in his shop. He purchases the products in Lomé. He works alone. At the moment, his primary difficulty is not being able to keep up with demand.

Nicolas has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to purchase general foodstuffs. He wants to reinvest in the business. In the coming years, Nicolas would like to expand the size of the business. He says that with the profits, he plans to take care of his family.

loans.use: To purchase general foodstuffs.

loans.name: Maria Yrene

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 24 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos menores de edad, viven en un caserío rural de nombre  “a Annape “, anexo del distrito de Morrope perteneciente al distrito de Lambayeque a unos 60 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo aproximadamente. En la zona en la que viven se tienen como actividad económica principal la agricultura y la ganadería.

Maria se dedica de manera diaria a la crianza y posterior comercialización de aves de corral como: patos, pavos, cuyes, ovinos entre otros, actividad a la que se ha dedicado ya un aproximado de 3 años, Maria desde muy pequeña junto a sus padres se ha dedicado al comercio no solamente de animales  si no que también tiene experiencia en otros productos relacionados con la agricultura
Ahora ella y su esposo tienes objetivos claros con respecto a su economía con el fin de darle una buena alimentación y buena educación por lo que se han propuesto trabajar juntos para lograrlo, su esposo esporádicamente se ayuda trabajando como obrero de campo o también se dedica a la pesca.

La zona donde vive Maria es un lugar donde constante caen lluvias, por lo que su casa esta un poco deteriorada y es por ese motivo que junto a su esposo ha decidido solicitar un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1500 Nuevos Soles que lo emplearan en la compra de materiales de construcción para los arreglos que amerita su vivienda.
Maria y su  familia son personas de condición económica humilde pero bien educados y con buenos valores.
texts.en:
María is a 24 year old mother.  She lives with her husband and two young children in a rural hamlet called Annape, which is in the district of Morrope, province of Lambayeque, and is about 60 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  The main economic activities of the region are farming and cattle-raising.

For about three years, María has been engaged in the daily raising and subsequent marketing of poultry such as ducks and turkeys as well as guinea pigs and sheep.  Ever since she was a little girl, Maria and her parents have worked together. They have not only worked in the marketing of animals, but also have experience working with other agriculture-related products.

Now, she and her husband have clear goals with respect to their finances.  Their goals are to provide their children with good nutrition and a good education and they intend to work together to achieve these goals.  Her husband occasionally helps working as a field hand or fishing.  

In the area where Maria lives, the rain falls constantly and this has caused their house to deteriorate somewhat.  For this reason, she and her husband have decided to request a loan of 1500 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  They will use the funds to purchase building materials for the repairs that their home deserves.  Maria and her family are people of modest economic means but they are well-educated and have good values.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for home repair.

loans.name: Limata

texts.fr:
Limata est une femme âgée de quarante trois ans. Elle est mariée å un retraité. Elle a un enfant de vingt ans qui va à l’école.
Limata travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2008. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Limata a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activté.
Dans les prochaines années, Limata voudrait augmenter son fond de roulement. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Limata is a 43-year-old woman. She is married to a retiree. She has a 20-year-old child who attends school.

Limata has been working as a retailer since 2008. She sells general foodstuffs in her shop for her customers. She purchases the products in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, her primary difficulty is stock shortages.

Limata has requested her second WAGES loan in order to purchase general foodstuffs. She wants to reinvest in the business.

In the coming years, Limata would like to expand her working capital. She says that with the profits, she plans to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase general foodstuffs.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 39 years old. An enterprising business lady, she is married to Peter, a businessman. She has been selling potatoes in an open-air market for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.


She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  Alice will use the loan to buy sacks of potatoes for her business. 


With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes for her business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice lives in Jacob Town. She is 40 years old and married. Her husband is a contractor They  have three children between 5 and 19  years old. For the past fifteen years Alice has been selling charcoal in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more  charcoal  for her business. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more  charcoal  for her business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 48 years old and a business lady. She is a single mother of three children. She has been selling fruit in an open-air market for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 15,000 which she uses to support her family.


She is applying for her first loan  from  KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Jane will use the loan to buy fresh fruit for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit for her business

loans.name: Khardiatou Harouna

texts.fr:
Madame Khardiatou Harouna  est une dame de 41 ans, mariée et  mère de 07 enfants dont l’ainé a 20 ans et le cadet ,11 ans. Elle fait du commerce depuis 8 ans, en vendant des tissus spécialement un  tissu très doux appelé « Khartoum » qui  est l’habit le plus porté en Mauritanie ; c’est d’ailleurs là bas qu’elle se ravitaille.
Elle est entrée dans le commerce par hasard et aimerai développer son activité et la diversifier. C’est pourquoi elle demande un crédit de 150000 FCFA. Elle appui son mari dans la gestion du foyer en s’occupant des frais de scolarité de ses enfants .D ans l’avenir, elle aimerait acquérir une machine à coudre pour se lancer dans la couture.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khardiatou Harouna is a 41-year-old woman, married and the mother of seven children, the eldest being 20 years old and the youngest 11. She has been in business for eight years selling fabrics, particularly a very soft fabric called "Khartoum," which is used in the outfit most commonly worn in Mauritania, which is also where she obtains her wares. 

She began this trade by chance and would like to build and diversify her business. This is why she is asking for a loan of 150,000 CFA francs.

She supports her husband in managing their home by paying her children's academic fees. In the future, she would like to get a sewing machine in order to add sewing to her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabric to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
10 mujeres de la ciudad de Caaguazú se han unido con el objeto de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo en conjunto poder salir adelante. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que tienen como objetivo primero poder ayudar a sus familias y darles un mejor estilo de vida.
Una de estas mujeres es la señora Elisa, quien nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de leche por todo su barrio. Ella comenta que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas para poder llevar su producto para la hora del desayuno. Gracias a la buena calidad de lo que vende se ha hecho de una buena clientela.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche en cantidad, con lo que podrá abastecerse y poder de esa forma tener en stock una buena cantidad. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Ten women in the city of Caaguazú have united with the goal of working together and, through their joint work, of getting ahead. They are very hardworking women who have as a primary objective helping their families and giving them a better lifestyle.

One of these women is Sra. Elisa who tells us that she sells milk throughout her neighborhood. She adds that she works every day from very early in the morning in order to deliver her product in time for breakfast. Thanks to the fine quality of her milk she has built up a good customer base.

She is requesting the loan to purchase milk in greater volume, so she will be able to store it and in this way have a good supply on hand. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: buy milk for later resale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is 32 years old and married with one child. She sells chips to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 10,000 Kenya Shillings to buy potatoes and cooking oil for making chips.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and cooking oil for making chips

loans.name: Ngoitai

texts.en:
Ngoitai has been buying and selling livestock for the last 10 years in Oloitoktok town. Besides livestock she also operates a general store. She is 54 years old and married to Nalanti. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to add to the stock of maize flour and soft drinks in her shop which she runs alongside the livestock business.

In future, Ngoitai hopes to practice large-scale livestock farming.

loans.use: to buy two goats to rear  and also add to the stock of maize flour and soft drinks for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 27 years old, single, and blessed with two children. Janet owns a beauty salon in Kangundo where she offers her service. She has been in this business for the last four years and gets an income of KES 10,000 per month.

Janet is applying for her first loan of KES.10,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to buy weaves, a dryer and cosmetics. She will use the anticipated profit to refinance the stock. 

She hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dryer, weaves, and cosmetics

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 40-year-old Lebanese married man. He’s living with his wife and five school-aged children. He’s doing his best to be able to offer them a respectable life. He opened his own car spare parts business in 1995, where he sells good quality items. Today, he’s looking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional car spare parts for his business. He notes that this will boost his sales and allow him to earn superior income. In the future, he plans to open his own car show room.

loans.use: to purchase additional car spare parts for his business

loans.name: Betuel

texts.es: Betuel de 38 años de edad, casado con Maximina de 36 años que fruto de este amor tienen 7 hijos, pues ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Periavente Alta del distrito de Llochegua. Betuel es un hombre con mucho talento para la agricultura, él se inicio en esta actividad gracias a sus queridos padres hace 18 años, quienes fueron los que le inculcaron el cultivo del cacao y café. En la actualidad trabaja con su querida esposa. Generalmente trabaja con la ayuda de su esposa e hijos pero en temporadas de cosecha siempre cuenta con peones quienes se encargaran en agilizar la recolección de los granos de café y cacao, para luego ser secados y vendidos a los acopiadores del distrito. Él está feliz con esta labor que realiza, por que le genera un ingreso económico rentable, el único inconveniente que tiene es que en épocas de invierno la carretera es inaccesible lo que genera el incremento del costo del flete. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete unas ves más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles realizará la compra de un terreno agrícola con cultivos de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Betuel, 38, is married to Maximina, 36, and they have seven children from this love.  They live in their own house located in the community of Periavente Alta in the district of Llochegua.

Betuel is a man with a lot of talent for agriculture.  He began this work 18 years ago thanks to his beloved parents, who were the ones who taught him about cacao and coffee crops.  Currently he works with his beloved wife.  Generally he works with the help of his wife and children, but at harvest season he always has farmworkers who speed up the harvest of the coffee and cacao beans, to later be dried and sold to the collectors in the district. 

He is happy with this job he does because it generates a profitable income.  The only problem he has is that in the winter season the highway is inaccessible, which causes an increase in transportation costs.

This will be his second loan with MFP, for which he promises once more to make his payments punctually.

With the 2,500 PEN he will buy a plot of farmland with cacao and coffee crops.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Benkadi sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames, avec en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent ensemble dans le village de Bounou Markala, région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de sucre, riz, cacahouète, condiments (aubergine, beurre de karité, tomates, …), articles divers de boutique (thé, bonbon, cigarette, boîtes d’allumette, …), de savon etc. 
Dans le but de satisfaire leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mama (1 ère femme sur la photo de la droite vers la gauche en position assise) est la vendeuse de sucre dans le groupe. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, deux sacs de sucre. Elle se ravitaille en sucre à la foire de Konodimini, et effectue ses ventes au comptant et à crédit à domicile et en ambulant dans les villages environnants, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Madame Mama espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18 000FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et contribuer pour les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The majority of the 10 women of the Benkadi Group are married in monogamous families; the women average 44 years of age and four children. They live together in the village of Bounou Markala in the Ségou region (4th Administrative Region of Mali). They met through family, neighborhood and marriage ties.

The members of the group run a small business selling sugar, rice, ground nuts, seasonings (eggplant, shea butter, tomatoes...), various boutique goods (tea, candy, cigarettes, matchboxes...), soap, etc.

With the aim of pleasing their customers, the members of the group have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are taking their first group loan.

Mrs. Mama (the first woman in a seated position in the photo, from right to left) is the sugar vendor in the group. She plans to use her loan to purchase two sacks of sugar. She obtains her sugar supplies at the Konodimini market and conducts her sales from her home and throughout the surrounding villages, for cash to a group of customers made up of men and women.

With this loan, Mrs. Mama hopes to see a monthly profit of 18,000 CFA francs, which will be used to reinvest in the business and to contribute to family expenses.

loans.use: To purchase sugar.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 34-year-old Mohamed from Goderich, western area in Freetown. He is divorced with 1 child, age 5 years. Mohamed's child attends school. 

Mohamed runs a tailoring shop at Ogoo farm. He sells male dress, female dress, stickers and traditional design cotton. He has been running this business for 15 years. He began his business in order to improve his standard of living. Before, he was doing petty trading. He works at the business, 6 days per week, 8 hours a day and has 6 employees working for him. His other source of income comes from the service of sewing. Mohamed says that the main challenges to his business are low capital and lack of collateral to access funding from financial institutions.

Mohamed has requested a loan in order to buy more sewing machines, threads, stickers, brillion and machine oil. The extra income from this loan will allow him to develop his standard of living and increase his level of income. In the future, he plans to open another tailoring shop in a different location and employ more youth. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more sewing machines, threads, stickers, brillion and machine oil.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 39-year-old business lady. She is a single mother of one child. She has been selling second hand clothes for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family.
 
She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Ruth will use the loan to buy a stock of clothes for sale.

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to rent a house and sell her clothes without walking around.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en: Joseline is a hardworking woman living in Hoima, Uganda. For the last 24 years, she has been farming and with the proceeds, she has been able to provide for the family. She faces the challenges of seasonal variations and inadequate funds to venture into mechanized agriculture. Her dream is to build a permanent house for her family and to expand her business to new markets. Joseline needs the loan facility to buy seeds and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for labor.

loans.name: Mangale

texts.en:
Mangale lives in Malindi, Kenya, and is married.  He has been involved in the transport industry for three years. He has a hired motorcycle.

Mangale is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to repair his motorcycle and start a green grocery stall.  His main challenge is the overall inflation which has reduced the purchasing power of most customers.

loans.use: repair his motor cycle and start a green grocery stall

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 47 years old and married with 1 child, aged 18 years.  He runs a local food store in Goderich, a western area in Freetown, Sierra Leone.

Mohamed has been in this business for 15 years and sells palm oil, Gari, beans, pepper and coconut at his store. He also earns income from his wife, who also has a small trading business.  He says that the main challenge to his business is inadequate capital to invest into his business.

Mohamed requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more palm oil, Gari, beans, pepper and coconut. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him expand his business and increase his standard of living. In the future, he would like to open more stores at different locations. He is grateful for your support.

loans.use: buy palm oil, Gari, beans, pepper and coconut

loans.name: Msisiri Group

texts.en:
Winfrida, who is in her early 40s, is married with one grown-up daughter.  She has been running a business selling sarongs and fabrics since 2000.  She works from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her stock of sarongs and fabrics, and pay household expenses and has paid back her loan successfully. She wants a loan to increase her sarong and fabrics stock. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Msisiri", which has a total of 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more sarongs and fabric

loans.name: Filbert

texts.en: Filbert is 32 years old, married and is very hardworking.  He owns a produce buying and selling business.  He started by selling his own farm produce and after accumulating enough profits, he now buys from other farmers.  He has a challenge of inadequate capital.  His family goal is to educate his children.  He hopes to expand his business to new markets.  Filbert needs this loan facility to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: buy maize

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is aged 36.  She has three children who all are enrolled in school. Her husband works as a house builder. With this loan, she will buy more rice and cooking oil to sell. With the profits, she wants to buy a house for residing.

loans.use: buy rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is 40 years old and married with six children living in Hoima, Uganda. She has been operating a produce business for seven years. She faces a challenge of high price fluctuations for produce and inadequate capital. Her family goal is to educate her children and her business goal is to expand to new markets. Monica intends to use the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy produce to sell

loans.name: Enath

texts.en: Enath is 36 years old. She has 5 children aged between 3 and 13, three of them go to school. She sells fabrics and sometimes does sewing.  With the loan, she will buy more fabrics from which she will make clothes.  She plans to use the profits for renovating her house.

loans.use: buy fabrics to make clothes

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a forty-six-year-old married man with four children living in Masindi, Uganda.  For the last twelve years he has been in the produce business.  He started with 200,000 shillings and now the business has grown. His dream is to educate children, build a permanent home and diversify and venture into new areas. Price fluctuations and inflation hinder his business.  George wants a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: buy maize and beans

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent wants a loan to pay school fees for himself.  He is 28 years old and lives in Masindi, Uganda.  He is a single  father and charged with the  responsibility of taking care of two children.  As a livestock farmer, his challenges are thieves who steal his cattle.  He desires to educate his children, enhance his education and diversify his business.

loans.use: pay school fees

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea de 57 años de edad es una mujer casada, que tiene un negocio a tevés del cual vende refrescos y también se dedica a la elaboración de bollos de mazorca: “amasijos de maíz, envueltos en hojas  de esta misma planta y amarrados con pita,   preparados con el maíz mas tierno y natural que solo Andrea conoce y le agrega queso, anís, etc. Ella con su negocio ha logrado apoyar a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y sus 5 hijos  en las edades de 36 a 44 años, quienes son profesionales exitosos.  Aunque Andrea inició con un pequeño e incipiente negocio, hoy vende en mayor cantidad  porque este ha crecido y se fortalece cada día más. En su negocio distribuye refrescos y bebidas como cervezas en grandes cantidades  a tiendas, establecimientos y vendedores de sus productos.  En la actualidad se prepara para la época de mayor movimiento comercial, “Los carnavales”, y está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  para surtir su negocio con gaseosas y cervezas y que sus clientes de tiendas, graneros, e independientes le compren en cantidades mayores.  Ella se está preparando  hacer su mejor venta del año.  Su meta  mas adelante es tener un estadero y mucha gente empleada,  para que también como ella,  obtengan sus ingresos con los que ha logrado el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: 57-year-old Andrea is a married woman who owns a business where she sells refreshments. She also makes corncob rolls: corn batter wrapped in leaves of the same plant, prepared with the most tender and natural corn, known only to Andrea, and mixed with cheese, aniseed, etc. Through her business she has been able to support her family, which is comprised by her husband and her five children aged 36 to 44, all accomplished professionals. Although Andrea began with a small start-up business, today she makes higher sales because the business has grown larger and stronger every day. In her business, she distributes refreshments and beverages such as beer in larger quantities to stores, businesses and people who sell her products. She's currently getting ready for her busiest time, the carnival, and she's applying for a credikiva, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it she will stock up her business with soft drinks and beer in order for her customers - the grocery stores and the independent ones - to buy from her in larger quantities. She's preparing herself for making her highest sales of the year. Her goal is to eventually own an eatery with a lot of employees, so that they too can get an income like she did, which allowed her to provide for her family.

loans.use: to stock up her business with soft drinks and beer.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 48-year-old widowed mother of seven children from Migori town, West of Kenya.

Jane operates a cosmetics shop, a business she has been doing for the last three years, making a monthly income of KES 25,000.  Jane is taking her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stock of beauty products for sale in her shop. Her profits will be used to repay the loan.  Her dream is to grow her business so as to improve her living standards.

loans.use: buy stocks of cosmetics

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is a 49-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children.  Three of her children are working and the other is still attending school.   Because of the heavy living expenses, Mona’s husband is obliged to work hard in order to cover their needs. He has been working on his own since 1989.   As for Mona, she has been working in the agricultural field for the past twenty five years.  She decided to have her own land in 1990, where she now cultivates all kinds of vegetables.  Today, she needs to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a shop where she can sell her products. This will certainly boost her productivity and thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and improve her business.

loans.use: buy a shop to sell her products

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy used the previous loan to purchase sugar, soap and cooking oil for resale. However, her challenge has been price fluctuations and inflation. Her dream is educating her children and turning her business into wholesale. Dorothy needs the loan to buy the same items.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is 29 years old and is married with 2 children, living in Hioma, Uganda.  He owns a phone charging outlet which burns CDs and sells phones.  He has been in business for over three years.  He faces a challenge of high fuel and transportation costs and inadequate capital.  He wishes to expand his business into new markets and diversify it into a movie library.  Edward intends to use this loan to purchase a computer for CD burning.

loans.use: buy a computer

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima is a widow who is 60 years old. She lives with her family of three orphaned grandchildren between 18 and 14 years old with three still schooling. She has been in farming for over 40 years and says farming income has always been the backbone of her family and now for her grandchildren. Her farm produces maize and beans, which are sold locally.

Alima has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy poultry chicks and build a housing unit for the poultry business. She adds this business will also help her increase her dairy numbers. She is focusing on having five dairy cows in the next five years from the current two.

Alima says the farming challenge remains the costly animal feed, especially during dry seasons. She is glad Juhudi Kilimo is availing loans to farmers and is pleased with the efficiency.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en: Seraphine is 40 years old. She is married and has three children, all of them attend school. Her husband sells shoes in the market.  Seraphine sells clothes and has spent 8 years in the same business. Seraphine has requested a loan to buy more clothes to sell. She plans to use the profits to renovate her house.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 29 years old. He is married and has two children aged between 4 and 5.  Both his children are enrolled in school.  

Jean Pierre has requested a loan to buy more charcoal to sell.  With the profits, he will renovate his house.   In the future,  Jean Pierre would like to buy a car to help the transportation of the charcoal in terms of distributing it to the customers.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Silveri

texts.en: Silveri is 47 years old and is very hard-working.  For over nine years, he has been running a bar.  He started with 500,000 shillings and now his capital has grown to over 2,000,000 shillings. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations and inadequate capital to meet customer tastes.  His family goal is to educate his children and he hopes to expand his business into new markets and buy land for crop growing.  Silveri needs this loan facility to buy a pool table.

loans.use: buy a pool table

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 26 years old. She has one child who is two years old. With this loan, she plans to buy newer equipment for her salon because she has been running the salon for the past four years. With the profits, she plans to renovate her house. She dreams of owning her house for her residence in the future.

loans.use: buy salon equipment

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is aged 32 and has been in active farming for 12 solid years in his hometown of Kitale in Western Kenya.  His farm produces maize and beans,  which he sells mainly to the local market for his family upkeep.  He works as a  mason besides farming, but emphasizes that the farming income covers the major part of his family needs.

Amos has requested a loan of  30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. He says he is venturing into the poultry business mainly to exploit the ready market for its products in the area.  He hopes to raise a farm of 2500 birds.  He adds that the income will help him educate his children, two of whom are already in school.  He has three children aged between 11 and 4 years.  

Amos points at the high costs of feeds and delicate management of  poultry diseases as challenges.

loans.use: buy poultry birds

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has been in farming for 11 years in her home area of Kitale where she lives with her family of four children between 18 and 6 years old. She says farming is her main source of income but she supplements it with her cereals retail business.

Beatrice has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. She says she wants to diversify her farming business in order to raise more income for the education of the children and to provide supplementary meals in addition to the regular income from maize and beans sales. She wants to have a farm of not less than 2,000 birds.

She points to the undeveloped local markets as the challenge to a great number of farmers.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Annonciate

texts.en: Annonciate is 33 years old. She is a widow with three children who are between 1 and 7 years old. Annonciate has been selling different foodstuffs in the boutique and she will buy more cooking oil and sugar with the loan. Annonciate plans to use the profits to pay school fees and provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She owns a salon which has been in operation for two years. Christine is married and has two children. She started off in business by visiting her clients before opening her own shop.

Christine was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase salon stock like hair lotion, Venus oil and other cosmetics.

Her main challenges are the high cost of products.  Christine looks forward to setting up other salons in the future.

loans.use: buy salon supplies

loans.name: Udzungwa Group

texts.en:
Exavery, who is in his early 30s, is married and has three children who are still going to school. He has been running a business selling books door-to-door.  He works from 7:00 am to 6:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Exavery's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to start building his house, paid school fees and household expenses, installed electric wires in his house and increased on his books stock.  He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He requested this loan to buy more books to sell.  His dream is to one day be able to supply to big organizations.

Exavery will share this loan with his loan group "Mt. Udzungwa", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more books to sell.

loans.name: Julianah

texts.en:
Julianah is a farmer and a resident of Kitale town in Western Kenya.  She is aged 51, married and has 6 children of middle ages, with the last two still schooling.  She has been in farming for 29 years, producing mainly maize in large scale for the local market.

Julianah has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds.  She says the venture into poultry farming will enable her to  spread her farming risk as well as supplement the family diet with eggs in addition to providing income to buy other foodstuff not produced within the farm.

She is worried about the low prices for farm produce within the local markets.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is 52 years old, married, has 6 children and lives in Hioma, Uganda.  He brews and sells a local gin commonly known as waragi.  He started in business by growing pineapples and after accumulating enough savings he started the waragi business.  He faces a challenge in the scarcity of inputs for brewing, too much heat which limits customer consumption, and high license fees.  His family goal is to educate his children.  He hopes to expand his business into new markets and also set up a modernized bar.  Wilson needs this loan facility to buy a generator and a freezer.

loans.use: buy a generator and freezer.

loans.name: Haller Wilfredo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE JUNTOS”; este banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Haller; El socio tiene 34 años de edad; el socio es conviviente, el socio tiene 1 hijo; el socio se dedica a la compra y venta de celulares y accesorios; el socio tiene un stand tienda en la cual expone sus productos, el socio en esta ocasion desea invertir en la compra de celulares nuevos y de accesorios para la venta. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de celulares y de accesorios.

El socio agradece la oportunidad del préstamo que le permitirá invertir en el negocio y crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Siempre Juntos Communal Bank.  This bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco.

Bank member Haller is 34 years old and he has a partner and one child.  He buys and sells cell phones and accessories for a living.  He has a stand where he offers his products.  Currently, this member wants to invest in the purchase of new cell phones and accessories to sell.  He is asking for this loan to buy cell phones and accessories.

This member is thankful for the opportunity to get this loan, which will allow him to invest in his business and grow financially.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and accessories

loans.name: Hasina

texts.en: Hasina, age 44,  has seven children between 4 and 23 years old. All the children go to school. She is married to a teacher. Hasina has been selling ladies clothes for the past 25 years. With the loan, she will buy more ladies clothes. She plans to use the profits to buy more ladies clothes to increase her inventory. She would like to become a ladies clothes supplier.

loans.use: To buy more ladies clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ebnias

texts.es: Ebnias de 24 años de edad, convive con Vidal de 27 años fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en la comunidad de Periavente alta del mirtito de Llochegua. Ebnias es una joven con deseos de superación en su vida diaria, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y bebidas en su propia vivienda donde habilito una tienda. En un inicio no tenia nada, mas que su propia casa y que con un poco de capital compró algunas bebidas y refrescos para venderlos. Supo juntar un pequeño capital a ello lo incremento el primer crédito obtenido de MFP, pues así logró montar su tienda de abarrotes con la que ahora tiene y poco a poco supo salir adelante gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación. Ebnias en un futuro esta pensando construir su vivienda de material noble con la finalidad de vivir mejor y mas cómodo. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles incrementara más productos y bebidas.
texts.en: Twenty-four-year-old Ebnias lives with her partner, 27-year-old Vidal.  They have three children and they live in their own home, which is located in the community of Periavente Alta in Llochegua.  Ebnias is a young woman who wants to get ahead in her daily life.  She sells groceries and beverages for a living in her own home, where she set up a store.  In the beginning, she didn't have anything but her own home and with a little bit of capital she bought some drinks and sodas to sell.  She was able to save up a little money and her first loan with MFP added to that, which is how she was able to set up the grocery store she has now.  Little by little she has been able to get ahead thanks to her hard work and dedication.  In the future, Ebnias is thinking of building her home from fine materials in order to live better and more comfortably.  This will be her second loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time.  With the 2,000 nuevos soles, she will buy more products and drinks.

loans.use: to buy basic foodstuffs and soft drinks

loans.name: Maurilio

texts.es:
El señor Maurilio esta solicitando un crédito con nosotros para los acabados del exterior de su vivienda que es para los enjarres de la pared y necesita comprar cemento, arena y pintura para el exterior. Con esta mejorar evitara que la humedad afecto en la salud de su familia. 
Don Maurilio es la única fuente de ingreso en la familia por lo cual cuenta con dos empleos, con los cuales puede mantener económicamente a su familia. Y con el cual pagar el crédito ya que le permitiría mejor el patrimonio de su familia.
texts.en:
Maurilio is asking for a loan with us to make the finishing touches on the exterior of his home.  He needs to stucco the walls and he needs to buy cement, sand, and paint for the exterior.  These improvements will keep the damp from affecting his family's health.

Maurilio is the only one who earns money in his family, which is why he has two jobs.  With them, he is able to take care of his family's finances.  They will also allow him to pay back his loan, which will allow him to increase his family's assets.

loans.use: to finish work on the exterior of his home

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a farmer and a father of four between 18 and 13 years old and all are schooling. He has been in farming for 10 years with his current produce being coffee, milk and maize sold to the local market.

John has made a loan request amounting to 63,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says farming has been the source of livelihood for his entire family. He adds once he purchases the dairy cow, his farming output will improve to meet his family obligations.

He, however, remains worried about the fluctuations in market prices.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 23 years old. She has one child who is 3 years. Immaculee sells charcoal and she has been running this business for the past 2 years. With the loan she will buy more charcoal to sell. She plans to use the profits to buy a house as her residence.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo se formó en un Barrio de la Ciudad de Caaguazú, las mismas son señoras muy humildes, trabajadoras y que desean progresar. Se reunieron asumiendo así un compromiso y una responsabilidad de retirar préstamo como comité  de mujeres solidario; con el fin de ayudarles como una herramienta más para el trabajo,. Todas ellas poseen entusiasmo, fuerza y las ganas de trabajar en equipo. Actualmente están el 11° ciclo.
Marina comenta que se dedica a la venta de joyas desde hace ya un buen tiempo. Gracias a su gran variedad de joyas siempre tiene una buena clientela, y es eso lo que la ayuda en los gastos que día a día surgen en el hogar. Su meta es poder tener un buen local para que de esa forma pueda darle mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de joyas en variada clase, con lo cual podrá abastecerse.
texts.en:
This group got together in a neighborhood of the city of Caaguazú.  It is made up of humble, hardworking women who want to get ahead.  They got together undertaking a commitment and a responsibility to take out loans as a committee of unified women.  Their goal is to help each other as another work tool.  All of them have enthusiasm, strength, and a desire to work as a team.  They are currently in their eleventh loan cycle.  Marina tells us that she has sold jewels for a while now.  Thanks to her wide variety of jewels, she always has a good clientele and that's what helps her with the household expenses that come up every day.  Her goal is to have a good location so that she can make her clients more comfortable.

She is asking for this loan to buy different kinds of jewels to stock up.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of jewels to sell

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en: Bosco is a 30 year old married man living in a semi-permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. He sells clothes and he got his initial capital from farming. His challenge is seasonal weather, high fuel and transportation costs, and taxes levied on his business. His dreams include educating his children, building a permanent home, buying a motorcycle and moving his business to a more permanent location. Bosco needs the loan facility to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Evanson

texts.en:
Evanson has been in active farming in his rural home for 12 years and currently runs his farm with the help of one farmhand. His produce, cabbages and tomatoes, are supplied to the local market. He works as a casual labourer for other farmers to raise more income to meet his family's needs.

Evanson has requested a loan worth 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy pigs. He says there is enough market for pork, due to the high cost of beef in the local markets. He reiterates that he will use the income to educate his children and to improve the living standards in all aspects of their lives.

Evanson says marketing, coupled with poor infrastructure, remains a challenge. Although these challenges are surmountable. He is optimistic that his business will continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en: Bosco is a 27 year old married man, with one child, living in a semi-permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a milling machine that he started two years ago. He started with one milling machine but now he has two machines. Despite his progress, his business challenges include high fuel and transportation costs, price fluctuations and inflation. His dream is to buy a motorcycle, build a permanent house, to buy land to grow crops and also to expand his business into new markets. Bosco needs the loan to buy a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for the transport business.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia de 58 años de edad, está casada con Félix de 70 años, fruto de este amor tienen 02 hijos. Juntos viven en la comunidad de Periavente alta del distrito de Llochegua. Emilia es una madre de mucho valor y dedicación para el trabajo en la agricultura, ella se dedica al cultivo de cacao y café, así como de frutas cítricas. Nos comenta que para emprender éste trabajo tuvo que valerse de las enseñanzas que le dejó su padre cuando era joven. Generalmente trabaja con el apoyo de su querido esposo, pero en temporadas de cosecha o limpieza de su parcela siempre requiere de buenos peones para que le puedan facilitar la faena. A Emilia le agrada tanto su trabajo por que le genera un buen ingreso económico, por lo que está pensando en un futuro dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes.
Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en efectivizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles contratará peones para que realicen el mantenimiento de su campo agrícola.
texts.en:
Fifty-eight-year-old Emilia is married to 70-year-old Felix.  They have two children.  They live together in the community of Periavente Alta in the district of Llochegua.  Emilia is a very courageous mother who is dedicated to her farming work.  She grows cacao and coffee, as well as citrus fruits.  She tells us that to get started in this work she had to rely on the the teachings she received from her parents when she was young.  She usually works with the help of her beloved husband, but during the harvest season and when it's time to clear her land she always needs good laborers to help her with the work.  Emilia likes her work so much because it makes her good money, which is why she is thinking about selling groceries in the future.

This will be her second loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time.  With the 3,000 nuevos soles she will hire laborers to help her keep up her farmland.

loans.use: to hire laborers to maintain her farmland

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wiklson is a resident of Muranga, in Central Kenya, where he lives with his wife and four children (between 13 and 7 years of age and all in schooling). He has practiced farming for 17 years and currently produces mainly milk and coffee, which he sells locally. He currently runs his farm with the help of one farmhand.

Wilson has made a loan request of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a pedigree dairy cow. This will be his third loan with Juhudi Kilimo, after the first and second ones of 30,000 KES and 55,000 KES, respectively. Wilson says the loans have helped him grow in business and now he wants to have pedigree dairy cows for better production and income. 
  
He is worried about the fluctuating market prices and high costs of feeds.

loans.use: to buy a chuff cutter and a knapsack sprayer.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is a father of five adult children and has been in farming for close to 20 years with farming income being his family’s sole source of livelihood. His farm is run with the help of one farmhand and produces pigs, maize and beans for the local market.

Gideon has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy piglets and build a housing unit for his growing number of pigs. He says he has decided to expand the pig business due to the availability of a market for his products. He adds that he is also focusing on improving the state of his residential building with the farming income.

However, he points out the inaccessibility of external markets as the major challenge as farmers generally get low returns within the local markets.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George has been in active farming for 5 years in his home area of Kitale, Western Kenya where he lives with his family of six children aged between 14 and 4 years. All his children are in school. He sells his produce of eggs and vegetables mainly to the local market.

George has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. This is George’s third loan with Juhudi Kilimo. He says Juhudi Kilimo loans have made him realize that farming business is reliable. He is glad to own three dairy cows and adds that he has been able to meet his family obligations like basic needs with much ease since he become an active farmer.

However, he notes that food shortage during dry seasons still remains a major challenge.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Yohana

texts.en:
Yohana has been active in farming for six consecutive years, with the poultry business being his core. His farm, however, produces maize and beans as well, which are all sold locally. He also gets additional income from from both a motorcycle and a retail shop business.

Yohana has made a loan request amounting to 90,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost his poultry business. He trusts that he will be able to meet the repayment of the loan and expand his farming business significantly. He hopes to acquire more assets and to live a better life with his young family. He is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan facility.

He is concerned about the seasonal changes, which make farming quite unpredictable.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds and to build a housing unit.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a mother of 7 children with the last three being of school going age. She is 47 and has been in farming for six consecutive years since she took it up as her core business. Her farm currently produces milk and vegetables.

Teresa has requested a third loan of 41,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy a third cow for her dairy business. She says Juhudi Kilimo loans have been of great help since she has realized farming too can be a lucrative business. She adds that life has been more bearable with Juhudi Kilimo loans since she manages to repay her loans and meet her daily basic family needs. She remains optimistic she will become a major supplier of dairy products for the local market.

Teresa notes however that dairy diseases are the major challenge in farming.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es:
Maricruz,vive en una comunidad rural, en Turrialba, llamada Santa Cruz.

Su familia la integran ella, su compañero y sus dos hijas menores de edad.

  Hace siete años ella inició la producción de pollos de engorde, con un primer crédito otorgado por la Fundación, cuando  era integrante de un banco mujer. Esta actividad es un  medio de generar ingresos, con los cuales ella  contribuye al presupuesto familiar cubriendo gastos :  de estudio y mejoras de su vivienda.

Cada día ella durante las mañanas, a las 6:30 am, lleva a sus hijas a la escuela , luego limpia los gallineros, les da de comer a los pollitos y continúa con sus labores domésticas.

Los sábados es el día que ella comercializa sus pollos, los que mata, pela y empaca y vende en su barrio puerta puerta.

Este crédito le permitirá continuar con su ciclo productivo, al comprar un número un poco más grande de pollos y darles el mantenimiento con alimento y vitaminas, para que logren el peso adecuado, según demanda.

Ella tiene entre sus planes el poder llegar a tener una granja más grande y poder en el futuro dar empleo a otras personas de su comunidad.
Con los ingresos generados y utulidades acumuladas dar buen estudio a sus dos hijas.
texts.en:
Maricruz lives in a rural community called Santa Cruz, in Turrialba.

Her family is formed by her, her partner and their two young daughters.

Seven years ago, she started to farm poultry, with a first loan provided by the field partner, when she was a member of the women bank.  Her business activity is a way to generate income, which she uses to contribute to the family expenses such as studies and betterment to the home.

Each day she takes her daughters to school at 6:30 AM, cleans after her chicken coop, feeds the chicks and continues with housework.

Saturdays are the day when she sells the chickens; slaughters the chicken, cleans them up, packs and sells in her neighbourhood door to door.

This loan will allow her to continue with her production cycle, buy a larger amount of chicks, take care of them with food and vitamins so they reach the desired weight according to demand.

She plans to be able to have a larger farm and employ people from her community. 

With the income generated and accumulated earnings she hopes to provide a good education to her two daughters.

loans.use: to buy 40 chicks every 7 weeks to feed them, grow them and sell them in the community. Also to buy 4 sacs of feed and vitamins every 7 weeks.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a resident of Litein in South Rift Kenya and has been in farming for 20 years with his main produce being milk and horticultural products. He also carries out a livestock trade to supplement his farming income.

Vincent has requested a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a pedigree dairy cow. He says his years of experience in dairy farming have equipped him with skills to manage the business and he hopes he will be able to get better returns with better quality breeds.

Vincent says lack of capital remains the major challenge in farming.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rodgers

texts.en:
Rogers is a farmer in Kitale in Western Kenya. He is 36 years old and married. He has 5 children, the first two are already attending school. He has been in farming for 5 years and produces beans, maize, millet, sweet potatoes and cassava. He also works as a tailor, for additional income.

Rogers has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help venture into the poultry business, which is currently experiencing a boom. He adds that the business income will help him improve his farming efforts on other products like dairy and sweet potatoes. This, in turn, will earn more income to educate the children.

He says drought and diseases are his major business challenges.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a mother of 2 children, one being an adult and the other a junior still in schooling. She is aged 51 and manages her farm with the help of one farmhand. Her farm produce of milk, maize, beans and vegetables are all sold within the local market. She lives with her family in their rural home in Kitale.

Miriam has made a loan request of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy another dairy cow and give a boost to her dairy business. She says the dairy business will improve her farming income and make meeting the family's basic needs more bearable. In addition it will provide milk for the family’s own consumption. She aspires to rank among major dairy suppliers for the local market in the future.

Animal diseases remain the major challenge, in her opinion.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is aged 54. He has been in farming for over 10 years, producing milk and maize. He also operates a transport business with a motorcycle. He is married and has 8 children, the last two still schooling.

Peter has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says he has decided to increase the number of dairy cows since he has gained more skills in management of the business, especially with feeding and treatment. He is certain that he will be able to make gains in the business.

He, however, clarifies that feeding and treatment of the dairy animals remains tricky for the local farmers and he advocates for more training to farmers.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine has been a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya for the last ten years, besides running a cereals business in the local market. She is married and  lives with her husband and one child, aged 15, in their rural home. Her farm produce of vegetables and maize are also sold within the local market.

Catherine has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. She wants to venture into poultry farming too, since it has a ready market and is more easy to handle with its faster turnover. She hopes to own a farm of up to 2000 birds. She adds that, the proceeds will help her in educating her child.

She, however, points out that the high cost of feeds and rampant diseases are the two leading challenges in the farming business.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Konoba Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Konoba sont mariées dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 40 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent dans le village de Bounou Markala, dans la  commune rurale de Sanando, région de Ségou.
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage et  font le petit commerce de produits cosmétiques (pommade et parfums), du savon kabakourouni, du sucre et des cacahouètes. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programma crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire.
 Madame Kadia (1 ère femme sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite) a une grande réputation dans la vente des produits cosmétiques de toutes sortes dans le village de Bounou Markala et ses environnants. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, deux cartons de crème pour la peau et 3 douzaines de parfums. Elle se ravitaille à la foire de Konodimini. Elle vend au comptant en détail et à crédit, à domicile et en ambulant dans les villages environnants à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Madame Kadia espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 7 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge le complément de condiments du foyer. 
A l’instar des autres femmes du groupe elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women of the Konoba group are married in polygamous families with an average of 40 years and three children between them.  They live in the village of Bounou Markala, in the rural community of Sanando, region of Ségou.

They have come to know each other through ties of kinship, neighbourhood, and marriage, and they do small business in cosmetic products (pomade and perfumes), kabakourouni soaps, sugar, and nuts.  

With the goal of increasing their commercial capital, the members of the group have decided to call upon the loan potential offered by Soro Yiriwaso; they are taking out their first solidarity loan.

Kadia (the first woman in the photo on the left; to the right) has a great reputation in the sale of cosmetic products of all kinds in the Bounou Markala village and its surroundings.

She plans to use the loan to purchase two cartons of skin cream and three-dozen perfumes.  She restocks at the bazaar in Konodimini.  She deals in cash and credit, both at home as well as moving through the surrounding villages to a clientele composed primarily of women.

Kadia hopes that with this loan, she will be able to realize a monthly profit of 7,000 FCFA, which will be subsequently reinvested in the business and enable the addition of condiments for sale.

As with the other women of the group, her goal is to increase the volume of her trade through this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products.

loans.name: Asoiva

texts.en:
Asoiva is a married 32-year-old mother of three. She plants and harvests taro, which is a staple food of Samoa, which she then sells. She has one year of experience in this business. Asoiva needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weedkillers, such as Gramoxome, to help her crop grow. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas per week) to continue expanding this new venture.

In 2012, Asoiva joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Asoiva's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weedkillers to help her taro crop grow.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.en:
Ysabel is a member of the group called Mujeres Progresando (women progressing) group 2, located in the city of Samana. This is her 6th loan, which she will use to improve her house. She has had her business for almost five years. Since then she has paid back all her loans and expanded her business. After her last loan, which she invested in her business, Isabel realized the need to improve her home.

This is the reason why she talked to other members of her group and they recommended her for a Housing loan to improve her home by building another room, coating her house walls with cement and painting them. Esperanza Internacional runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as running their business and attending their group meetings.

Ysabel is the mother of five children and she lives with them and her husband in their own home, which still need to be completely built (In the photo, Ysabel and her younger daughter are in the entry of their house). She will uses this loan to buy construction materials like concrete blocks, cement and others. 

Ysabel thanks God, Esperanza Internacional and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family she thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy cement, concrete blocks, and other construction materials.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is forty-two years old and married with three children. She bakes and sells a variety of baked goods in the local community.  She has four years of experience with this business venture. Mariana  needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase additional cooking ingredients to supply her baking. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 Talas per week) to continue expanding the business.

In 2012, Mariana  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Mariana's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients to supply her bakery business.

loans.name: Opetera

texts.en:
Opetera is forty-nine years old, married, with five children. Her oldest child is twenty-three and her youngest is seven. She owns and operates a small plantation, where she plants and harvests taro for sale. She has one year of experience in this business. Opetera needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome, which will help her crop grow. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 Talas per week) to continue improving her operation.

In 2012, Opetera joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Opetera's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killer to help her taro crop.

loans.name: Elenoa

texts.en:
Elenoa is forty years old and married with seven children. She owns and operates a fishing venture, catching and selling ocean-caught fish. She has many years of experience in this business. Elenoa needs a loan of WST $1,550 to invest in expanding the business so she can increase her profits. She plans to use the profit from selling the fish (estimated to be 130 Talas per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Elenoa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Elenoa's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her fishing business.

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en:
Faafetai is a married forty-four-year-old mother with six children, ranging from just five years old to twenty-four. She owns and operates a food stall, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business. Faafetai needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase ingredients needed to make her baked goods for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 Talas per week) to continue improving her business. 

This is Faafetai's third loan with SPBD. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make baked goods for sale.

loans.name: Tièssiri Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques, les dix femmes du groupe Tièssiri ont en moyenne 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivent dans le village de Bounou Markala, dans la  région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de galettes de mil, gâteaux, articles divers de boutique (thé, bonbon, cigarette, boîtes d’allumette, …), tubercules, de savon etc. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe  adhérent à l’institution de microfinance  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mawa, 1 ère  assise  à droite, fait la préparation et vente de galettes de mil.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs de mil. Elle se ravitaille en mil à la foire de Konodimini. 
Pour faire de la galette, on pile le mil, le débarrasse du son, le lave avec de l’eau pour ensuite le moudre. La farine ainsi obtenue est pétrie avec l’eau simple et bien d’autres ingrédients  tel le sucre, la levure. Le mélange obtenu est ensuite frit dans l’huile pour être vendu. La vente se fait au comptant, en détail et à crédit à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes et d’enfants. 
Madame Mawa espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer. 
A l’image des autres femmes du groupe, elle a pour objectif d’avoir un moulin multifonctionnel dans le village afin de diminuer leurs peines de décorticage et de mouture des céréales.
texts.en:
The Tièssiri group is made up of 10 women who are, for the most part, married in polygamous families.  They are, on average, 40 years old and have 5 children each.  They live in the village of Bounou Markala, in the Ségou region (4th administrative district of Mali).  
The members of the group sell millet cakes, pastries, various grocery products (such as tea, candy, cigarettes, matchboxes etc.) as well as tubers and soap.
In order to increase their business, they have joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  This is their first solidarity loan.  Mawa, sitting at the far right in the photo, prepares and sells millet cakes.  She intends to use her loan to buy 3 bags of millet.  She buys millet at the Konodimini market.  To make a millet cake, millet has to be crushed, the husk is removed, then the millet is washed with water and ready to be ground.  The flour obtained is mixed with simple water and other ingredients such as sugar and yeast.  The obtained dough is then fried in oil and is ready to be sold.  Mawa sells her millet cakes from home.  She sells for retail and for cash, and sometimes on credit, to customers of both genders and all ages.  With this loan, Mawa hopes to see average monthly profits reach 15,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in the activity and used to provide for her family.  
Like the other women of the group, her goal is to have a multifunctional mill in the village, which would make the tasks of shelling and milling grains much less tiresome.

loans.use: to buy millet.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Nasiba 48 letnaya vdova s odnim rebenkom. Ona upravlaet pekarney, u nee chetvero rabotnikov. Oni pekut khleb i razdayut v magazini. Nasiba stararayetsa radi budushego svoego rebenka, chtobi obesbechit ego uchebu. Ona xochet v kredit 1500 AZN dla togo chtobi kupit muku i novie oborudovaniya dla vipechki. Etim ona budet dobivatsa rasshireniya svoego biznesa i postroit noviy prostorniy pekarniy cekh. Nasiba ochen trudolubivaya i otvetstvennaya jenshina kotoraya dobivaetsa postavlennoy celi.
texts.en: Nasiba is a 48 year old widow with one child. She runs a bakery and has four employees. They bake bread and distribute to the stores. Nasiba tries hard for the sake of her child's future so she can provide for his education. She wants to get a loan in the amount of 1,500 AZN to buy flour and new equipment for baking. By this she will be working towards expansion of her business and building a new spacious baking shop. Nasiba is a very hardworking and responsible woman who achieves the goals she sets.

loans.use: to buy flour and new equipment for baking.

loans.name: Fia

texts.en:
Fia is fifty-nine years old and married with six children. She runs a business venture, catching and selling fish from the ocean. She has many years of experience in this business. Fia needs a loan of WST $1,000 to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 125 Talas per week) to continue improving her business and increasing profits.

Fia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Fia's fifth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her fishing business.

loans.name: Faleata

texts.en:
Faleata is a seventy-five-year-old widow with twelve children. She owns and operates a business venture, providing clothing services to local community members. She has many years of experience in this business. Faleata needs a loan of WST $1,500 to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 Talas per week) continue improving her sales.

In 2011, Faleata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Faleata's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her clothing business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is forty-seven years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a business venture, selling pork products in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Rosalina needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 200 Talas per week) to continue improving her business.

In 2012, Rosalina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Rosalina's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional pork products for sale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is forty-eight years old and married with five children. She runs a small business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business. Maria needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 250 Talas per week) to continue expanding the business.

In 2012, Maria joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Maria's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to buy ingredients needed to make baked goods for sale.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a married thirty-three-year-old woman with three children. She runs a small plantation, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Loreta  needs a loan of WST $2,000 to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 150 Talas per week) to continue improving her banana sales.

In 2010, Loreta  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Loreta 's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to expand her banana plantation.

loans.name: Faavae

texts.en:
