Faavae is fifty-four years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a tailoring business, providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. She has many years of experience in this business. Faavae needs a loan of WST $1,750 to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the profit (estimated to be 300 Talas per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2006, Faavae joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Faavae's sixth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase materials to expand her tailoring business.

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita is forty-eight years old and married with six children. She owns and operates a small plantation, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Makerita needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 300 Talas per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Makerita joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Makerita's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and equipment for growing taro.

loans.name: Valelia

texts.en:
Valelia owns and operates a business venture, selling breadfruit products in the local community.  She is forty-five years old and married with nine children. She has many years of experience in this business. Valelia needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase ingredients, such as breadfruit, that she needs to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 Talas per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

Valelia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Valelia's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase more breadfruit to produce products for sale.

loans.name: Galulolo

texts.en:
Galulolo is a fifty-two-year-old woman who is married with two children. Through her business, she provides general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. She has many years of experience in this business. Galulolo needs a loan of WST $1,600 to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 Talas per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2010, Galulolo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Galulolo's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and materials for tailoring services.

loans.name: Sofaronia

texts.en:
Sofaronia is thirty-two years old and married with five children. Sh runs a small business, catching and selling fish from the ocean. She has many years of experience in this business. Sofaronia needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 Talas or US $167 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

Sofaronia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Sofaronia's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase hooks and nets to support her fishing business.

loans.name: Oripa

texts.en:
Oripa is thirty-five years old and married with six children. She owns and operates a small business, baking and selling specialty goods and delicacies in the local community. She has four years of experience in this business. Oripa needs a loan of WST $2,700 to purchase additional cooking ingredients. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 Talas per week) to pay her children's tuition fees.

Oripa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Oripa's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to bake specialty goods and delicacies.

loans.name: Fualilia

texts.en:
Fualilia is thirty-two years old and married with three children. She owns and runs a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Fualilia needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 300 Talas per week) to continue improving her store.

Fualilia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Fualilia's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory to increase her product offering.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is forty years old with a husband and six children. She owns and operates a small store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Telesia  needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 200 Talas or US $83 per week) to pay her children's tuition fees.

Telesia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Telesia's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her store, such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste.

loans.name: Olailagi

texts.en:
Olailagi is a seventy-seven-year-old widow with seven children. She runs a small plantation, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has one year of experience in this business. Olailagi needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 Talas or US $83 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Olailagi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Olailagi's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and equipment for growing taro.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is forty-seven years old and unmarried with four children. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has one year of experience in this business. Filomena needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 Talas per week) to improve and expand the business.

Filomena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Filomena's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and equipment for growing taro.

loans.name: Sulita

texts.en:
Sulita is twenty-seven years old and single with two children. She owns and operates a small business, selling sweets and confections such as cookies and cakes in the local community. She has one year of experience in this business. Sulita needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 150 Talas per week) to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

In 2012, Sulita joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Sulita's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is twenty-five years old and married with one child. She catches and sells fish from the ocean. She has two years of experience in this business.  Mariana needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 350 Talas or US $146 per week) to improve the business.

In 2010, Mariana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Mariana's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase hooks and nets to improve her fishing business.

loans.name: Malemo

texts.en:
Malemo is forty-nine years old and married with four children. She is starting a business venture, selling soft drinks in the local community. Malemo needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 300 Talas per week) to improve the business.

In 2012, Malemo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Malemo's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase soft drink products to sell.

loans.name: Ivoga

texts.en:
Ivoga is thirty-five years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a business venture, selling specialty food products in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business. Ivoga needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase the raw ingredients she needs to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 300 Talas per week) to pay her children's tuition fees.

In 2011, Ivoga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Ivoga's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Tuleigalii

texts.en:
Tuleigalii is a married thirty-two-year-old mother of three children. She has a small business selling lavalavas (print fabrics that wrap around the bottom-half and are worn by both men and women). She has three years of experience with this business. Tuleigalii needs a loan of WST $2,450 to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 450 Talas per week) to pay her children's tuition fees.

In 2009, Tuleigalii joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Tuleigalii's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials for making lavalava (Samoan sarongs).

loans.name: Sauao

texts.en:
Sauao is fifty-nine years old and married with nine children. She owns and operates a business venture, selling lavalavas (print fabrics that wrap around the bottom-half and are worn by both men and women).  She has two years of experience in this business. Sauao needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 400 Talas per week) to improve the business.

In 2012, Sauao joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Sauao's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and materials to make lavalavas (Samoan sarongs)

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is sixty-three years old and married with five children. She owns and operates a business venture, providing new clothing services to local community members. She has many years of experience in this business. Zenaida  needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 400 Talas per week) to expand the business.

In 2012, Zenaida joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Zenaida's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to buy fabric and materials for a clothing business.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita belongs to a village bank called “Señor de Accha.” The bank is located in Pisaq, a district of Urubamba province in the Cusco department. Jovita is thirty-seven years old and has two children. In order to support her family, she runs a vegetable stand in the produce market. The market is generally open six days a week from 5 a.m. to 4 p.m. Through her business, Jovita offers fresh produce such as squash, yuca, and carrots to her local community.

Jovita needs a loan in order to purchase vegetables for her stand. She dreams of expanding her business in Pisaq and has committed to making her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for her fruit stand.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese is sixty-three years old and widowed with nine children. She owns and operates a business venture, providing dress-making services to local community members. She has many years of experience in this business. Akenese needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase materials to make dresses.  She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 400 Talas) to improve and expand the business.

In 2012, Akenese joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Akenese's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her dress-making business.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Unidas nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de un grupo de mujeres que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes se fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas en lo personal como en lo laboral.
La Sra. Aurelia es una de las integrantes del grupo, y nsos cuenta que se dedica a la costura hace ya varios años, gracias a lo cual ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Dice que gracias a Dios siempre tiene muy buena cantidad de clientes, lo que le da buen ingreso.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para la compra de telas e hilos, con lo cual podrá entregar pedidos que tiene.
texts.en: The Mujeres Unidas committee (Women United) was born through the management and support of a group of women who found themselves working in the same place. This is the committee of the City of San Lorenzo, and they have as their main goal the personal and professional growth of each of their members. Aurelia is one of the group's members, and she tells us that she has worked as a seamstress for several years, thanks to which she has been able to make ends meet and help her family. She says that thanks to God, she always has a good number of customers, which gives her a good income. She asks for Kiva's help to but fabric and thread, so she can fulfil her orders.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia belongs to a village bank called “Señor de Accha.” The bank is located in Pisaq, a district of Urubamba province in the Cusco department. Eulalia is thirty-five years old and sells wholesale and retail produce in the local marketplace. The market is generally open six days a week from 5 a.m. to 4 p.m. Eulalia's stand offers fresh vegetables such as squash, beans, peppers, and limes.

Eulalia plans to use her loan to purchase vegetables for her business. She is thankful for the support and hopes to continue attracting more buyers and expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for her produce stand.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata belongs to a village bank called “Señor de Accha.” The bank is located in Pisac, a district of Urubamba province in the Cusco department. Fortunata is thirty-five years old and supports her two children on her own. She sells fruit and vegetables in the local market, which is generally open six days a week from 5 a.m. to 4 p.m. Fortunata’s stand offers an abundance of fresh greens, including yucca, carrots, lettuce, cauliflower, and limes.

Fortunata needs a loan in order to purchase fruits and vegetables. By expanding her selection of produce, she hopes to attract more buyers and increase the success of her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for her produce stand.

loans.name: Soberana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sobeana lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María Antonieta quien se dedica al comercio de dulces tradicionales cajeta, atol, buñuelos, arroz de leche, sopa de borracha desde hace 5 años. El crédito lo invertirá en materia prima leche, dulce, coco, maíz, leña…etc. Con el fin de salir adelante.
Ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos pero a su cargo están los cuatro menores de 5,12,13 y 16 años respectivamente.
Las otras integrantes son Josefa quien se dedica al comercio de comida y fresco desde hace 10 años y Margarita quien vende zapatos desde hace 7 años.
texts.en:
The 'Sobeana' group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial people. One of them is María Antonieta whose business is selling traditional sweet treats, 'cajeta' (a thickened syrup made of sweetened caramelised milk), atole (a traditional, corn-based hot drink), donuts, rice pudding and 'sopa borracha' (sponge cake soaked in syrup and rum).  She has been in this business for five years.  She will invest her loan in buying ingredients: milk, dulche de leche, coconut, corn, firewood, etc. so that she can make progress in her business.

María Antonieta is married and has five children.  She currently cares for her four youngest who are 16, 13, 12 and 5.

The other members of this group are Josefa, who has been selling food and soft drinks for 10 years, and Margarita, who has been selling shoes for 7 years.

loans.use: to buy ingredients (milk, dulce de leche, corn, firewood, etc.)

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: El Sr. Wilfredo tiene 52 años no es casado pero tiene pareja, no tiene hijos por ahora es Sr. Wilfredo es agricultor, tiene una parcela que se encuentran en Villa Florida. Es cliente antiguo de la institución ya que este préstamo es su quinta secuencia, El Sr. Wilfredo va a usar este préstamo para la siembra de papa y cosecha de maní, la  razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar la producción y cosecha de sus productos agrícolas Wilfredo enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y utilizar los beneficios para incrementar sus ingresos, una cosechado sus productos lo vende en el mercado de la zona directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 52 years old.  He is not married but he does have a partner.  He does not have children.  Wilfredo is a farmer.  He has a plot of land in Villa Florida.  He is an existing client of the institution and this is his fifth loan.  

Wilfredo will use this loan to sow potatoes and harvest peanuts.  He is requesting the loan to improve his production and to harvest his produce.  Wilfredo faces challenges in his business such as managing to climb out of poverty and using his profits to increase his income.  Once harvested, Wilfredo sells his produce in the market in his area.  He sells directly from producer to consumer.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds to sow and to harvest his peanuts

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Virgen de Rosario se conformó en en año 2.010, con mucho esfuerzo ya  se encuentran en el 4° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Reina quien se dedica a la costura nos comenta que mediante este negocio la economía de la familia mejoró bastante ya que ella mantiene la casa y a su madre ya anciana. Es por su familia que ella siempre se esfuerza mucho, pues no quiere que pasen por ningún tipo de privaciones.
 Según la Sra. Reina mencionó que las actividades que realizan con la Fundación Paraguaya es muy importante ya que mediante ella pudieron  desarrollar sus  capacidades de trabajo, autoestima y desarrollo personal.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder seguir trabajando, ya que quiere comprar telas e hilos para cumplir con pedidos que tiene
texts.en:
The 'Virgen de Rosario' women's committee was created with a lot of effort in 2010.  The group is now in its 4th loan cycle and its members are working together in a supportive manner within the program.  In addition to their own work, each member also carries out joint activities to raise funds so that they have some capital within the group.

One of the group's members is Reina whose business is sewing.  She tells us that, through this business, her family's finances have improved quite a bit as she is able to support her household and her elderly mother.  She always works hard for her family as she doesn't want them to experience any hardships.

Reina mentioned that the activities that they carry out with Fundación Paraguaya are very important because they enable them to develop their work skills and self esteem, and develop on a personal level.

Reina is requesting this loan so that she can continue working as she would like to buy fabric and thread to fill the orders that she has.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Las Nicaragüenses Group

texts.es:
Las Nicaraguenses lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras ellas son Nemesia, Ana y Yolanda. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Nemesia quien se dedica al destace de cerdo desde  hace 10 años, negocio que con ayuda de sus nueras ha ido creciendo. Ella invertirá en cerdo, leña, maíz…etc.
La señora Ana tiene una pulpería la cual inicio con una pequeña venta de chiverías hace 9 años y Yolanda tiene una pequeña venta la cual desea aumentar.
texts.en:
'Las Nicaraguenses' (The Nicaraguan Ladies) is a group of three hard-working women: Nemesia, Ana and Yolanda.  Nemesia is the group's coordinator.  Her business for the past ten years has been slaughtering pigs.  Thanks to the help of her daughters-in-law, her business has been growing.  She will invest her loan in buying pigs, firewood, corn, etc.

Ana has a grocery store.  She started out in her business selling snacks 9 years ago.  Yolanda has a small sales business that she would like to expand.

loans.use: to buy pigs, corn, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr:
Madame Hawa  est une dame de 44 ans qui s’active dans le commerce depuis 4 ans. Elle est divorcée, mais vit avec ses enfants. Son activité consiste à vendre des denrées alimentaires : elle gère en fait une boutique ou elle vend aussi du café. Elle a déjà bénéficié de 2 crédits  et ce troisième prêt lui permettra de renforcer d’avantage son stock. 
Bien qu’étant divorcée elle s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille.  Hawa  compte beaucoup sur la caisse pour diversifier son activité et augmenter  ses marchandises.
texts.en:
Hawa is a 44-year old woman who has been actively trading for four years. She is divorced but lives with her children. Her business is selling groceries: in fact she manages a shop where she also sells coffee. She has already had two loans and this third loan will enable her to boost her stock further. 

Although she is divorced she takes care of her family's daily expenses. Hawa is relying heavily on the savings bank to diversify her business and increase her stock of goods.

loans.use: to buy groceries: drinks, water and other products for resale (also sale of coffee)

loans.name: Balvina

texts.en:
Balvina belongs to a village bank called “Señor de Accha”. The bank is located in Pisac, a district of Urubamba province in the Cusco department. Balvina is thirty-eight years old and married with two children. She sells fruits and vegetables in the local market, which is generally open six days a week from 5 a.m. to 4 p.m. Balvina’s stand features kitchen staples such as lettuce, carrots and potatoes. 

A loan will allow Balvina to purchase vegetables for her business, so that she can continue offering fresh produce to the local community. She is grateful for the loan and has committed to making her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for her produce stand.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.en:
Alejandrina belongs to a village bank called “Señor de Accha". The bank is located in Pisac, a district of Urubamba province in the Cusco department. Alejandrina is forty-seven years old and has three children. She supports her family by selling artesanal products in the craft market, which is often frequented by tourists visiting nearby Macchu Picchu. Alejandrina’s offerings include locally-sourced crafts such as hand-knit alpaca textiles and accessories such as gloves, scarves, and socks.

Alejandrina is requesting a loan in order to replenish her stand with local handicrafts. With this loan, she hopes that she will be able to offer her customers the best possible selection of souvenirs.

loans.use: to purchase artesanal products.

loans.name: Anasii

texts.en: Anasii is a 46-year-old woman who is married with 11 children. She owns and operates a fishing business, catching and selling fish from the ocean. She plans to use the WST $1,500 loan to buy materials to keep her business going. Anasii plans to use her profits, which she estimates at WST $400 per week, to continue growing her business and supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as hooks and nets to support her fishing business.

loans.name: Susitina

texts.en: Susitina is a 55-year-old married woman with 6 children. She runs a small plantation where she grows produce to sell in her community. She needs the WST $2,450 loan to buy farming supplies to continue her business. Susitina plans on using the profit from her sales, estimated at WST $300 weekly, to improve her business and take care of her family. This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Selepa

texts.en: Selepa is a 39-year-old woman who is married with 5 kids. She owns and operates a small plantation where she grows produce to sell in her community. She has 4 years of experience running this business. Selepa plans on using her WST$2,250 loan to purchase farming supplies to help her crop grow. She will use the profits from her sales, estimated at WST$400 weekly, to continue to improve her business and support her family. This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Pesi

texts.en:
Pesi is thirty-eight years old and married with five children, ranging from one to nineteen years old. She runs a small plantation, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has five years of experience in this business. Pesi needs a loan of WST $2,500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 400 Talas or US $167 per week) to continue to expand the business.

In 2008, Pesi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Pesi's fifth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to buy seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda belongs to a village bank called “Señor de Accha”. The bank is located in Pisac, a district of Urubamba province in the Cusco department. Hilda is thirty-six years old and married. She operates an internet shop, which is important to local community members who may not have cyber access at home. Hilda welcomes her customers with a warm and open personality. Now, she hopes to further improve her business by requesting a loan. 

Hilda is requesting the loan in order to maintain the computers and customer seating in her shop, as well as purchase computer accessories such as mouses and keyboards, as needed.

loans.use: to maintain computers and customer booths.

loans.name: Mawugnon

texts.fr:
Mawugnon est une femme âgée de trente et un ans. Elle est mariée å un jardinier. Elle a trois enfants, dont deux à l’école. Le premier a quatorze ans et le dernier a huit ans.
Mawugnon travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2000. Elle vend du charbon de bois et des céréales pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Mawugnon a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois et des céréales. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Mawugnon voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mawugnon is a 31-year old woman, who is married to a gardener. She has three children, two of whom are at school. The eldest is 14 years old and the youngest eight.

Mawugnon has been working as a retailer since 2000. She sells charcoal and cereals to all types of customers at home. She buys her products in Lomé and works alone. Her main difficulty at the moment is not being able to satisfy all customer demand. 

Mawugnon has requested her second loan from WAGES so that she can buy charcoal and cereals. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the next few years, she would like to expand her business. She says that she is planning to take care of her family with the profits.

loans.use: to buy sacks fo corn, millet and beans

loans.name: Faaifo

texts.en:
Faaifo is 38 years old and married with 6 children whose ages range from 3 to 22. She owns & operates a business venture of raising & selling farm-raised fish.  She has 5 years of experience in this business. Faaifo needs a loan of WST $3,200 to purchase additional fish to raise.  She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 500 talas per week) to expand the business.

In 2006, Faaifo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is her 6th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to buy more fish to raise on her fish farm.

loans.name: Nive

texts.en:
Nive is 64 years old and married with 9 children from 22 to 42 years old. She runs a small farm, planting & harvesting taro to sell, which is a Samoan staple.  She has 1 year of experience in this business. Nive needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 400 talas per week) to continue improving the business.

In 2012, Nive joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment for taro, such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San is 50 years old and generates her income by making bamboo baskets for sale along with her main rice farming business. Since she became a single parent who lives with a single child in the Pouk district, she has met many difficulties in daily life. Her other two children live separately around the province with their new families. 

She has applied for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a pair of cows to keep for her rice farm. Consequently, she won’t need to hire animals from other villagers as she did in the past. She hopes she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase a pair of cows to keep for her rice farm.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is twenty-five years old and married with a one year old and a five year old. She owns and operates a small business venture, selling soft drinks in the local community. She has one year of experience with this business. Ruth needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 350 Talas per week) to continue to expand the business.

In 2012, Ruth joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Ruth's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make products for sale.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is forty-two years old and married. She runs a small business, providing dress-making services to local community members. She has many years of experience in this business. Pauline needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 400 Talas per week) to improve and expand the business.

Pauline joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Pauline's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and materials for her dress-making business.

loans.name: Jesugnon 12 Group

texts.fr: JESUGNON 12 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. Le représentant du groupe, Dossa Emmanuel (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgé de 40 ans. Dossa Emmanuel est marié à Odette, une marchande. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge, en plus de leurs enfants. Dossa Emmanuel vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Dossa Emmanuel a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire, puis a appris la couture, une activité qu’il exerce passionnément depuis une quinzaine d’année et qui lui permet de nourrir sa famille. De façon secondaire, Dossa Emmanuel  fait de l’élevage dans sa région. Dossa Emmanuel s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but de renouveler ses équipements par l’acquisition d’une nouvelle machine à coudre et d’acquérir d’autres fournitures de couture, Dossa Emmanuel sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe   JESUGNON 12 .  Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: Jesugnon 12 is a group of three people, who live in the same district of Benin. The representative of the group, Dossa Emmanuel (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 40 years old. He is married to Odette, a trader. The couple has five children, all at school and in their care. They also have another child in their care apart from their own children. Dossa Emmanuel lives with his wife and children. The couple cover the various household expenses together. Dossa Emmanuel left school at primary level and then learnt how to sew, an activity which he has been carrying out with passion for around 15 years and which allows him to feed his family. He also raises animals in his area as a secondary activity. Dossa Emmanuel gets his supplies in Benin. With a view to renewing his equipment by acquiring a new sewing machine and other sewing materials, he is, together with the other members of Jesugnon 12 group, requesting a third loan from Alidé. This loan will enable them to respond better to customer demand and make more money.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and sewing materials

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea, forty, is married, and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a staff member of a local organization. Her husband is a farmer who is involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up cattle. 

In order to improve her family livelihood, Sophea is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase piglets to breed in order to sell for a profitable price when they gain weight. In the future, she would like to run a pig farm and support her children to study further. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger to provide a better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed in order to sell for a profitable price when they gain weight.

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en:
Bienvinida is married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Bienvinida is fifty-one years old and has two children who are in school.

Bienvinida has a general store business in the Philippines. Bienvinida requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Bienvinida has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, Bienvinida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en:
Rasela is 53 years old and married with 7 children, aged 12 to 32 years old. She owns and operates a small plantation where she plants & harvests taro to sell.  She has 1 year of experience in this business.  Rasela needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 450 talas per week) to expand the business.

In 2012, Rasela joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to buy weed-killers, such as Gramoxome, to help her taro crop grow.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan, 44, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh city. Her husband breeds milk cows to earn an income. 

Loan has been running a general store to sell household products and personal use items for people in her community for ten years.

Loan is requesting a loan to purchase a wider variety of products to meet the demands of clients, such as cooking oil, sauce, seasoning salt and toys for kids. 

She hopes this will enable her to increase her income, so that she can send her children to a good school and improve her family living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, sauce, seasoning salt and toys to sell in her store.

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um is 41 years old. She is married and has been blessed with 4 children, 3 of whom are supported by her income. The family’s income is generated through cultivating rice, raising pigs and selling firewood. Nowadays Um is raising some piglets in a wooden pigpen behind her house. She is happy to deal with this type of business. 

She is now requesting some funds, a third cycle loan with HKL, to purchase a buffalo, which will be used to haul the firewood trailer. This loan enables her family to develop their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep is 39 years old and is married. She has two children and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a bricklayer.

Diep has been rearing cows for sale for fifteen years. She would like to apply for a loan to enable her purchase more cows to rear and sell later at a profit.

She hopes this loan will help her to increase her income, improve her family's living conditions and provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more cows to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Masina

texts.en: Masina is a 52-year-old married mother of 7 children. She owns and operates her own business, which is raising cattle. She has 5 years of experience in this business. Masina needs a WST$1,500 loan to purchase supplies to support her business. She will use the profits, an estimated WST$400 per week, to continue to grow her business and take care of her family. This is her 5th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to buy supplies to raise her cattle.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Ros (in the photo) is a television and radio repairman and his wife, Savin is a weaver. They have been married since 2004 and have two children: one son and one daughter. One is in school and another one is still young. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Ros is asking for his second loan for the amount of $500 to purchase weaving materials for his wife’s weaving business. He will also use a part of the loan to repair the house where he lives.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for his wife’s weaving business and repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is fifty-six years old and married with four children. Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, diapers and other groceries. 

In the future Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Iddi

texts.en:
Iddi is a 38-year old married man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda.

He owns a produce store that he started five years ago. He started his business with six hundred thousand shillings and now it is worth two million shillings. 

His biggest challenge is price fluctuations and inflation. His dream is to educate his children, buy land to grow crops and expand his business into new markets. Iddi needs the loan to buy maize to resell.

loans.use: to buy maize to resell

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is sixty-one years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Angelina has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Angelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Angelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy green vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera is a 39-year-old business lady in Mariakani. She is a divorced mother of three. 

She sells brooms, a business she has been doing for the past three years successfully.

This marks her second borrowing from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more brooms to sell to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. 

She hopes to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more brooms

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Yei. She sells clothes, and has been in business for six years. She is forty years old, married, and has six children; three of them are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 1,000 in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is twenty-seven years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Madelyn has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Madelyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Madelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is twenty-nine years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Merlyn provides a motorela (motorcycle with a side car) service, with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

Merlyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Merlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for her motorela service.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is twenty-nine years old, married to Paul, and blessed with two children aged eleven and seven. She is a tailor, a business she has been doing for five years and earns a monthly income of KES 5,000. 

She has requested a loan worth KES 80,000 to buy cloth. Her profits will be plowed back to her business. She hopes to educate her children and lift up  their living standards. This is her third loan.

loans.use: To buy cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe, a 36-year-old married mother of three children living in the Philippines, has been operating a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages for 10 years. A new member of HSPFI, Fe is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina lives in Yei. She operates a food stall, and has been in business for four years. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children; one of them is still in school. Selina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG500 in order to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Zacharia

texts.en: Zacharia is 43 years old and married with 4 children. He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for 5 years and has employed one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya Zacharia has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy maize flour, soaps, sodas and sugar for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, soaps, sodas and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Lydia has a shop that sells coconuts for copra & green bananas. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of bananas & coconuts to sell.

Lydia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lydia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of bananas & coconuts to sell

loans.name: Flordeluna

texts.en:
Flordeluna is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Flordeluna has a shop that sells green bananas & coconuts for copra. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of bananas & coconuts to sell.

Flordeluna is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Flordeluna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of bananas & coconuts to sell

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Manuel solicita un crédito, ya que desea invertir en comprar mas variedad de mercancía para su negocio, ya que a obtenido muy buenas ganancias, su esposa le ayuda en el negocio es quien se encarga de buscar y comprar la mercancía en donde este en mejores condiciones y mas barata. 
Con este préstamo desea invertir en comprar mercancía por mayoreo y así obtener un mejor precio y obtener ellos más ganancias para la familia. 
Con las ganancias del negocio pagaran el crédito ya que con esta inversión les ira mucho mejor porque sus clientes les están solicitando mas variedad de ropa, zapatos y que tengan articulo de electrónica.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel is requesting this loan as he would like to invest in buying a greater variety of merchandise for his business because he has made very good profits.  His wife helps him in the business.  She takes care of finding and buying merchandise which is in good condition, cheaply.

Juan Manuel would like to use this loan to invest in buying merchandise wholesale so that he can obtain it at a better price and thereby make more profits for his family.

Juan Manuel will use the profits from his business to repay the loan.  With this investment, his business will do much better because customers are requesting a greater variety of clothes and shoes, and asking him to stock electronic items.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothes and shoes) to sell

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana is a 44-year-old single lady. She is living with her mother and siblings. Since the death of her father a year ago, Adriana as the eldest automatically took over the responsibility for covering her family needs. 

Adriana has a kiosk and pig breeder businesses; these businesses are the major income source that enables her to support her family. Basic items are available at her kiosk such as snacks, detergents, shampoo and candies. She would like to add various stocks at her kiosk but the profit generated is usually spent on their daily needs.

This situation drove her to seek a loan to improve her kiosk business. She got information that TLM can help her by providing a business loan. She then submitted a loan application and is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 3,000,000. 

This loan will be used to complete her kiosk stock with nine basic needs, snacks and soft drinks. She is sure that the improvement of this business will benefit her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase nine basic needs, snacks and soft drinks for her store.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Forty-three years old, married to Jane and the father of two school-going children, Peter has been welding in Nakuru town for the last 11 years. Introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, he is requesting his first loan with which he will buy welding machines to add to his stock. In the future, Peter hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Nakuru area.

loans.use: To buy welding machines.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is 40 years old and married with three children. He does kale farming to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years and has employed three people. He does dairy farming to earn extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy kale seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy kale seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with three children. 

Nora has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Nora has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Nora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Rice husbandry is a common business for Soeun, age 59, who lives together with his family in Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. His wife helps him in earning income by working in the same type of business. Presently Soeun has been blessed with nine children: five are single and four are married.

This time, for his fifth loan from HKL, Soeun would like to pay a rented farmland fee, thus, he will be able to use the land again for growing his dry-season rice. His dream is to save enough money to buy and own farmland for rice farming.

loans.use: to pay a rented farmland fee.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Erlinda has a shop that sells fish like trout, sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Erlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun is 40 years old and a responsible mother of three single children, living in Kompong Cham province, where she and her husband operate a type of business as local rice cultivators. She has been engaged in the business for over 10 years. She usually plants her rice crops twice a year to produce enough food from her land.

With the requested amount, she’ll pay for the construction laborers repairing her house. And with the balance of the funds, she will buy a breeding pig for offspring, and rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to keep her crops in good condition.

loans.use: to pay for the construction laborers repairing her house.

loans.name: Roem

texts.en:
Roem, 50 years old, is preparing her soil to grow dry-season rice in a new cycle. From agriculture, Roem is able to generate a good income of $5.00 per day to satisfy her living expenses. Her husband and some of her children also assist her in managing this farming project. She now has got five children. Two among them are married and live separately in the province.

She is taking out the amount of KHR 1,000,000 to pay for plowing. She feels very happy with the loan because it’s helping her to develop her business further.

loans.use: to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Patrick Wafula

texts.en:
Patrick is 47 years old and married to Alice and  they are blessed with five children aged 21, 19, 16, 15 and 12 years. He is in the motorcycle business which he started five years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 9,000.

He has requested KES.30,000 to pay school fees. His hope is to be a self-reliant person. This is his second loan.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for two years. She is 28 years old, married, and has two children; one of them is still in school. 

Jenifer heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 29 years old and married with four children. She does bean farming to earn a living. She has been in the business for eight years and has employed four people. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy bean seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy bean seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en:
Khiev is from Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She is an industrious mother of five children, four of whom are attending school, while the eldest has an independent family. 

Khiev is in the business of cultivating rice alongside her husband on a few piece of farmland. Khiev hopes to lead her family attain a comfortable life someday as she strives to work harder. She now wants to get involved in animal husbandry and improve her living standard through this type of business. As a result, Khiev and her husband have joined a course related to animal care, the teacher being a professional vet.

She wants to acquire this loan to pay for the whole course. She would like to say thanks to our lenders. This loan provides her family good advantages to build and strengthen her business further.

loans.use: to pay for a course related to animal care.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: El señor Antonio vive en la casa de su mama, el señor es divorciado ya mas de 10 años, tiene 4 hijas de las cuales todas están casadas y tienen familia, el señor se dedica al servicio de cerrajería junto a su yerno el cual le ayuda con la atención de la cerrajería, El Sr.  Antonio tiene casa propia en la zona Pilancho, pero por la distancia el prefiere quedarse en la localidad de Sacaba donde se encuentra su negocio por el trabajo, en época de sembradillo el señor Antonio se dedica a la agricultura. El préstamo es para la compra de material de trabajo y herramientas nuevas para su taller de cerrajería, es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Antonio lives in his mom's house.  He has been divorced for more than ten years.  Antonio has four daughters who are all married and have their own families.  His business is providing a metalwork service together with his son-in-law who helps him out in the business.  Antonio has his own home in Pilancho district but, owing to the distance, he prefers to stay in the town of Sacaba where his business is located.  During the sowing season, Antonio works in agriculture.  This loan will be used to buy work materials and new tools for his metal shop.  He is a very hard-working person who feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loans.use: to buy work materials and new tools for his metal shop

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has been in the clothing sales business in Nakuru town for the last seven years.  She is 38 years old and single.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of its field officers and this will be her second loan.  She paid her previous loan of KES 20,000 well and in good time and it was very profitable for her.  

Rose plans to use this loan to buy more clothes to sell.

In the future, Rose hopes to grow her business and acquire a shopping mall and thereby become one of the leading business people in her area.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
Hay, age 42, is a loving mother of four school-aged children, living in Prey Chor district, where she was born. She has a common-law relationship with her husband who works as local rice farmer, the same as her. Most of the time, this couple works together to generate a good income from the land both in rainy season and dry season. 

Presently Hay needs some additional funds to complete the unfinished parts of her house. Consequently, she is looking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to attain her dream of having a suitable shelter that provides her family a warm and comfortable living as others have. In the future, she wants to lead her business towards an improvement.

loans.use: to complete the unfinished parts of her house.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married lady, 33 years old, and a mother of three school-going children. She owns a furniture workshop that generates income of KES 25,000 monthly and has been in operation over a period of 13 years.

Sarah has borrowed a loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD, this being her second loan after paying back the previous loan successfully. She wishes to use the amount to pay secondary school fees for her child.  


She will  plough her furniture shop profits back back into the business. Her dream is to educate her children to higher level.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Lolita has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has been in business for 10 years. She requests a loan for 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Lolita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Lolita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sell.

loans.name: Dariimaa

texts.en:
Dariimaa is 36 years old and lives with her husband and six kids in Western Mongolia.  Her husband is a herder and four children are students. 

She started retailing coal and wood in 2011.  Her sales have been good and she plans to expand in order to improvement her family's livelihood.  She is a good-natured woman who says, "I would like to expand my business by getting supplies in large quantities so that my business income and family livelihood will raise.  I have to save much for my six children's college fees from now on."  

The total amount she is requesting is 700,000 MNT for supplies.

loans.use: to get supplies in large quantities.

loans.name: Asnat

texts.en:
Asnat is a 42-year-old single lady. She is living with her sister and niece at their house. Asnat initiated a motor taxi business called ‘Ojek’ five years ago.  Actually her parent does not agree with the business that she runs as this business is mostly run by men and it entails risk as well. Nevertheless, she gladly runs the business.
 
Furthermore, Asnat runs a piglet breeding business to earn extra income. She has been running pig breeding for years, even before running the motor taxi business. She plans to raise two more piglets to resell after six months but she needs a business loan to support her business.  

Therefore, she submitted a loan application to TLM and requested a loan of IDR 3,000,000 to buy two piglets. She is hoping that TLM is willing to approve her loan application.

loans.use: to purchase two more piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase locks and plaits.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with five children. 

Myrna has a shop that sells home-made ice cream in a variety of flavors like mango and cookies & cream. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for home-made ice cream.

Myrna is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for home-made ice cream

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Doña Victoria tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como operario de   maquila, tiene 2 hijos de 16 y 6 años de edad y los dos están estudiando, y vive en una aldea de Chamelecón, San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Dona Victoria tiene un negocio de una pequeña pulpería la cual logro establecer hace año y medio. Vende productos como refrescos, huevos, golosinas (churros, galletas, confites etc.)Utensilios de baño y algunos productos enlatados. Empezó su negocio vendiendo poco producto en el cual se le ha dificultado complacer la demanda de algunos productos alimenticios. Ella trabaja mucho todo el día y todos los días de la semana para obtener ingresos extras que le ayuden a mejorar su vida económica. También se dedica a la venta de comida como tamales, baleadas, tacos, pollo con tajadas.
Victoria solicita un préstamo de 10,000 lempiras para invertir en la compra de producto que le hacen falta en el negocio como (granos básicos frijoles, arroz, harina, maseca, carnes, embutidos y lácteos), ya que estos productos son los que demandan diariamente. Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar el incremento en su inventario como también los ingresos y la atención de servicio a los clientes.
Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio para seguir generando los ingresos que le permitan seguir dándoles la educación necesaria a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Victoria, age 39, is married, and her husband works as at an assembly plant.  She has two childen, ages 16 and 6; both children go to school.  She lives in the village of Chamelecón, San Pedro Sula, Cortes.

Victoria has a small grocery store, which she managed to establish a year and a half ago.  She sells products like soft drinks, eggs, sweets (churros, cookies, candy, etc), bathroom utensils, and some canned products.  She started her business by selling a few products, which has made it difficult to meet the demand for some food products.

She works a lot all day, every day of the week in order to get extra income to help her improve her financial situation.  She also sells food like tamales, “baleadas” (flour tortillas with beans, eggs, butter, cheese and meat), tacos, and chicken with sliced plantains.

Victoria is requesting a loan for 10,000 lempiras to buy products that she needs in her business.  She will buy products like basic grains, beans, rice, flour, instant corn flour, meat, sausages, and dairy products.  There is a daily demand for these products.  This investment will help her to get more inventory and income, and it will improve customer service.

Her goal is to continue growing in her business in order to generate the income that will allow her to continue giving her children the education they need.

loans.use: to buy products like basic grains, beans, rice, flour, instant corn flour, meat, sausages, dairy products, and others.

location.town: Colonia Suyapa, Chamelecon, San Pedro Sula, Cortes

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Yei.  She sells charcoal, and has been in business for four years.  She is 30 year old, married, and has four children; two of them are in school. 

Joyce heard about BRAC South Sudan from its credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 500 in order to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fee.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a 50 years old man from Vihiga in the Western part of Kenya.  He is married to Florence and they have four children.

Joshua operates a bicycle spare parts business, that he has operated for the last 13 years.  He makes a monthly income of about KES. 17,000.   

Joshua is taking out his third loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy spare parts worth KES. 30,000.  His profits will be used to repay the loan.

His dream is to educate children.

loans.use: to buy bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 49 years old,married with 3 children.  She does dairy farming to earn a living and has been in the business for 3 years.  She describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since Cecilia joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save some income and hopes to expand her business in the future.  She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy 3 dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy a 3 dairy cows.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Rita is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 5 children. 

Rita has a flower shop and flower garden and sells different kinds of flowers.  She has had this business for 5 years.  

Rita requested a loan for 5,000 to buy fertilizers for the flowers.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  

In the future, Rita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her flower business.

loans.name: Li

texts.en:
Li is 38 years old and has four single children, two of whom are sewing staff for a garment factory in Phnom Penh city. Recently she has been operating a fast-food selling business in her neighborhood, Ruessey Keo. She sells foods like grilled beef with pickle, papaya salad, boiled eggs and meatballs and she earns approximately $5.00 per day through this type of business. 

She would like to apply for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to replace the old one, which frequently breaks down, to support her husband in providing his taxi service. Li has a strong determination to improve her standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old windowed and blessed with five children.  She owns a salon in Babadogo and also offers people means of transport. She has been in business for eleven years and earns an income of about KES.20,000 per month.

Josephine has got good credit history with KADET and she is applying for her third loan of KES.100,000 from KADET LTD.  She plans to buy new equipments for her salon and repair her vehicle. 

She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.  In the future, Josephine hopes to add more vehicles and expand her transport operation.

loans.use: to buy new equipments for her salon and repair her vehicle.

loans.name: Annaline

texts.en:
Annaline is 44 years of age and a mother of three children. She is married and is in the business of selling used clothes. She started this business six years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

She has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy bales of dresses for ladies, shirts and trousers. Her profit from this business would help her venture into another business. This is her fifth loan. Her dream is to prosper in her life and businesses.

loans.use: To buy bales of used dresses for ladies, shirts and trousers

loans.name: Caacupé Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 13 integrantes de la ciudad de Encarnación. El comité  tiene  experiencia en trabajo grupal, ya que  son meses  los que trabajan juntas, se reúnen cada semana para compartir, comunicar e interiorizarse de las novedades que se generan dentro del grupo.
Una de las integrantes, Edit, tiene 29 años, está acompañada con Juan, quien es albañil, tienen 6 hijos, quienes son el objeto de lucha de esta pareja. Edit se dedica a la venta de chipa desde hace un buen tiempo, pero nos cuenta que su deseo es poder tener su propio local y así poder ayudarle a su marido a generar ingresos para su hogar, ya que el dinero que gana no le alcanza para poder empezar con los trabajos que ella desea realizar es por eso que se integro al comité de su barrio para que con la ayuda que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya pueda empezar con el trabajo que desea realizar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de chipas para poder revender, y de esa forma poder estar un paso más cerca de su sueño.
texts.en:
This committee has 13 members who are from the city of Encarnación.  The committee members have experience working as a group as they have been working together for months.  They meet every week to share stories, chat and find out what has been happening within the group.

One of the members of this group is 29-year-old Edit.  She lives with her partner Juan, who is a builder, and they have six children who are their reason for working hard.  Edit's business is selling cheese buns and she has been in this business for a long time.  She tells us that she would like to have her own sales premises so that she can help her husband to make income for their household.  The money that she earns isn't enough to start carrying out the work that she would like to do and so she joined her neighborhood committee so that she could use Fundación Paraguaya's help in starting the work that she wants to carry out.

Edit is requesting a loan to buy cheese buns to resell.  This will enable her to take a step closer to fulfilling her dream.

loans.use: to buy cheese buns to sell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Lilibeth has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Lilibeth is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lilibeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He is responsible for his family and doing the best he can to enrich their way of living. 

Youssef started his own business seventeen years ago.  He's owned a cattle farm and looks forward to growing his operation.  In parallel, he has been working at a local company since 2003.  

Today, he’s requesting to borrow a loan from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase cattle for his farm.  He notes that this will increase his productivity and develop his business.  

In the future, he plans to open his own dairy products shop.

loans.use: to purchase added cattle for his farm.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Ramil sells chicken eggs by the tray.  He has had this business for 10 years.  He requests a loan of 5,000 to buy eggs to resell.

Ramil is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ramil hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 4 children. 

Rosemarie has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 5 years.  Rosemarie requested a loan for 4,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rosemarie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rosemarie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Yei.  She sells fish and has been in business for four years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children; three are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from its credit officer.  Tthis is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 500 to purchase fish. 

She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fee.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Nhel

texts.en:
Nhel, a loving mother of five children, has been residing in Prey Chor district.  To generate income, she cultivates rice and other crops.  She is a happy rice farmer and her husband is supportive by maintaining the rice field.  Besides farming, Nhel also makes thatch, from which house roofs and walls are made.

At the present, Nhel is applying for a loan from HKL to purchase a plot of farmland to ensure the growth of her business.  She hopes that she’ll be able to attain a good harvest from this land in the coming season.  She is very grateful to our lenders for the support of her business.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farmland to ensure growth of her business.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Mary Jean has a shop that sells coconuts for copra and bananas.  She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requests a loan of 4,000 to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.  Mary Jean has been a member of HSPFI since 2006.  In the future, Mary Jean hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Rukiia

texts.en:
Rukiia lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for four years. She is 38 years old, married, and has two children; one of them is still in school. 

Rukiia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 40 years old, and married to Brigta, and they have three school going children.  He has operated his metal box making business for the last 15 years.

He was introduced to KADET LTD, by one of its existing clients and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy more raw materials to make more boxes to ensure the sustainability of his business, and make more profit.

In the future, Kennedy hopes to open a big manufacturing company and become one of the leading manufacturers in Nakuru.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials to make more boxes.

loans.name: Humphrey

texts.en:
Humphrey is 20 years old.  He does quarrying to earn a living and has been in business for one year.  Humphrey describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same work. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future.  He has applied for a 20,000 Kenya Shillings loan to rent productive land for quarrying.

loans.use: to rent productive land for quarrying.

loans.name: Ilene

texts.en: Ilene, 28 years old and single, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages for five years. A new member of HSPFI, Ilene is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks for her store and raw ingredients for making snacks. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks for her retail store and raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: El Espino Group

texts.es:
El Espino está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Vilma de 54 años quien se dedica al comercio de comida. Este negocio lo inicio con la venta de fresco luego invirtió en comida de poco a poco. Ella está casada y su meta es que su negocio crezca por ello invertirá el crédito en granos básicos, carne y perecederos para el negocio.
Las otras integrantes son Silvia quien se dedica al comercio de tortillas desde hace 8 años y Nidia desde hace 3 años vende maní.
texts.en:
'El Espino' is a group of three hard-working and entrepreneurial people.  One of them is 54-year-old Vilma whose business is selling food.  She started out in business selling drinks then gradually invested in food.  Vilma is married and her goal is to grow her business.  She will invest her loan in buying basic grains, meat and perishable goods for her business.

The other members of this group are Silvia, who has been selling tortillas for 8 years, and Nidia, who has been selling peanuts for three years.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, perishable goods, etc.

loans.name: Miled

texts.en:
Miled is a 57-year-old Lebanese man who lives with his wife. He finds it really hard to cover their expenses. 

That’s why he decided to start his own business in 2007.   He rents apartments upon requests.  In parallel, he has been working in a local restaurant for the past five years. 

Today, he has the intention to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform needed maintenance on his apartments. This will augment his sales therefore increase his revenues. 

In the future, he plans to take more kiva loans and develop his business.

loans.use: to perform needed maintenance on his apartments.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva lives in Yei.  She sells fish and has been in business for two years.  She is 38 year old, married, and has three children; one of them is in school. 

Eva heard about BRAC South Sudan from its credit officer, this is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 500 to purchase fish.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun is 32 years old, a humble cultivator who lives in Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province.  She has a life partner with her husband who works as a policeman in the commune.  They have been blessed with 5 children: two are married and three are students attending school. 

With the amount of money she has requested from HKL, she will pay to plow her land.  She’s preparing her soil to grow rice crops and now she has enough farming materials for this project. 

For her prospects, she will expand her farmland and develop her business in the following years.

loans.use: to plow her land.

loans.name: Kepher

texts.en:
Kepher is a 54 years old business man in Mariakani.  He is a married father of six.  

He sells used electronic equipments, a business he has operated for the past twelve years successfully.

This marks his first loan term with KADET LTD, to finance his business.  He plans to purchase used fridges and television sets.  He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and repay his KADET loan. 

He hopes to have an established business.

loans.use: to purchase used fridges and television sets.

loans.name: Ife Group

texts.fr: IFE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine.
