La représentante du groupe, Pélagie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans. Pélagie n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pélagie est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Bernadin. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Pélagie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges,  Pélagie vend depuis une quinzaine d’années, du maïs de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Pélagie vend des chaussures, des sacs de sortie et de la farine de manioc.  En vue d’élargir son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Pélagie sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe IFE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: IFE is a group comprised of three members whom are friends and belong to the same group of revolving credit. The representative of the group, Pélagie (who has her hand raised in the photo) is 34 years old. She never attended school, is married to a mechanic named Bernadin, and has four children, a few of whom attend school. Pélagie lives with her husband and children. The couple share the responsibilities of the home. In order to contribute to the financial responsibilities, Pélagie has been a travelling saleswoman for maize during the past 15 years. She has also sold bags, shoes and cassava flour. She is hoping to broaden her retail activity and better satisfy her customers. She is asking for a third loan from ALIDE, along with the other members of the IFE group. This loan will allow them to better respond to customer demands and increase their profits. Their first two loans were reimbursed in a timely manner.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize and cassava flour, shoes and bags

loans.name: Mahudjro 19 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUDJRO 19 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui vivent dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Victoire est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Victoire est âgée de 41 ans et vit au Bénin. Victoire n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Victoire est une veuve et mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Victoire vit seule avec ses enfants. Victoire assure seule ses divers besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Afin d’assurer ses diverses charges, Victoire vend depuis quatre ans, des poissons frais et divers produits (riz, huile végétale, etc.) dans sa boutique. Parallèlement, Victoire vend de la farine de blé. Victoire s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Victoire sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUDJRO 19, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra certainement de hausser le niveau de leur activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Mahudjro 19 group is made up of three people who are friends and who live in the same neighbourhood. This is the third time that the group requests financial aid from ALIDé, in order to raise the level of their activity. The representant of the group, named Victoire is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Victoire is 41 years old and lives in Benin.Victoire did not attend school. She is a widow and mother of five children who all go to school at her expense.Victoire lives alone with her children. She supports her own and her children's needs without assistance. In order to assure her various expenses, Victoire has sold fresh fish and different products (rice, vegetable oil etc.) in her boutique for the last four years. At the same time she sells wheat flour.Victoire buys her products in a town in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and increase her turnover and her income, Victoire requests together with the other members of the Mahudjro 19 group a third loan from ALIDé.This loan will most probably enable them to enhance their activity and make more profit. The two previous loans were repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy crates of fish and various products (sacks of rice,vegetable oil).

loans.name: Malchinhuu

texts.en:
Malchinhuu is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in Western Mongolia. His wife does construction decoration in summertime and his two kids study at the local secondary school. He has been retailing sacks of wood and coal since 2002. His sales have been rising lately and he is planning to get the supplies in large amounts so that he can expand the business activities. 

Also, he operates a taxi service business using his own car. He is a bright and good-natured man who says, "I would like to expand the business to make it easier for me and for my customers. I have further plans to save for my kids' college fees." The total amount he is requesting is 1,200,000 MNT for the supplies.

loans.use: To purchase coal for sale

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
In Baray district of Kompong Tom, family micro-businesses are very common for local people. Pig-raising is preferable for them besides rice farming. Yorn, a mother of three children, has been operating this type of business for over five years to help her husband in earning income. However, the main source of income is generated by her husband, who goes from place to place around the province to sell his firewood. 

In order to sustain the family-owned business, Yorn would like to ask for some funds from HKL to keep as a sufficient capital to buy a stock of firewood for constant future sale. This loan will help to develop her standard of living. With the increase in income, Yorn will save to ensure a good future for her three school-aged children.

loans.use: to buy a stock of firewood for constant future sale.

loans.name: Flin Jesus Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FLIN JESUS est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontines. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Marie-Claire est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Marie-Claire est âgée de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Marie-Claire n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Marie-Claire est mariée à un cuisinier du nom de Raoul. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Marie-Claire vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin de contribuer aux divers besoins de la maison, Marie-Claire vend depuis huit ans, des produits divers (glacières, pâtes alimentaires, lait, et des tubercules d’ignames) à son domicile. Parallèlement, Marie-Claire vend de la farine de blé. Marie-Claire s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin et au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Marie-Claire sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FLIN JESUS, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Flin Jesus group is made up of three friends who belong to the same investment group. This is the third time that the group has asked for financial help from  ALIDé in order to boost their activity. 

The group's representative, Marie-Claire, has her hand raised in the photo. She is 37 years old and lives in Benin. Marie-Claire did not go to school. She is married to a cook named Raoul. The couple has three children, all of whom have been educated and are in their care. Marie-Claire lives with her husband and children. Together, the couple takes care of the various household expenses. 

In order to contribute to the family's needs, Marie-Claire has been selling various products (coolers, pasta, milk, yams) from home for the last eight years. At the same time, she sells wheat flour. Marie-Claire obtains her supplies in a town in Benin and in Nigeria. With the goal of satisfying her customers and to increase turnover and income, Marie-Claire, along with the other group members, is asking for a  third loan from  ALIDé. The two previous loans were fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy various products (wheat flour, coolers, yams, wheat, pasta).

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Ama est une femme âgée de trente trois ans. Elle est mariée å un frigoriste. Elle a quatre enfants, dont trois à l’école. Le premier a sept ans et le dernier a deux ans.
Ama travaille comme revendeuse de pagne et de charbon de bois depuis 1999. Elle vend des pagnes et du charbon de bois pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille avec une personne. Au moment, sa difficulté principale la rupture de stock.
Ama a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes et du charbon de bois. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ama voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Ama is a 30 year old woman who is married to a refrigeration and air conditioning technician. She has four children between the ages of 2 and 7, three of whom attend school. Ama has been selling cloth and wood coal since 1999, traveling to customers' homes. She purchases the products in Lomé. She works with one other person, and their main challenge is not running out of stock. She is asking for her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase more products and reinvest in her retail activity. In the coming years, Ama would like to increase her business. She will use the profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: purchase loincloth and bags of wood coal

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Julio tiene 33 años de edad vive en el municipio de Chimoré provincia Carrasco de la ciudad de Cochabamba junto a su esposa y sus hijos viven hace muchos años en Chimoré, 
Julio se dedica al pesca y crianza de peces que vende a los mayorista en la ciudad de Cochabamba, también realiza trabajos de limpieza y mantenimiento de casas y cabañas respecto al crecimiento de la hierba y arreglos de jardín, Julio y su esposa tuvieron una vida tranquila hasta que llego el fallecimiento de su hija que por falta de un  tratamiento médico oportuno no pudieron combatir la enfermedad  de su amada hijita, desde ese momento Julio se prometió no pasar por la misma situación y  estar más pendiente de la salud de su familia. Ahora tienen otra hijita y ella es la representación para que juntos puedan enfrentar malas situaciones y  con arduo trabajo podrán conseguir la felicidad que buscan. 
 Julio actualmente necesita  comprar un equipo más, para seguir trabajando en el manteamiento de cabañas e implementar con algunos aspectos a su  actividad piscícola por lo que se enteró de los créditos Kiva y sin pensarlo dos veces solicito un préstamo a nuestra institución, con lo cual  incrementara sus  ingresos y poder ofrecer a su familia mejores comodidades de  vida.
Julio no pierde la esperanza de seguir  luchando y trabajar, superar los momentos tristes que paso con la muerte de su hija.
texts.en:
Julio is 33 years old and lives in Chimoré, in Carrasco province, Cochabamba.  He and his wife have lived with their children in Chimoré for many years.  

Julio's business is fishing and raising fish which he sells to wholesalers in the city of Cochabamba.  He also cleans and carries out small jobs in people's homes and cabins such as cutting lawns and doing gardening work.  Julio and his wife led a peaceful life until their daughter passed away.  As she did not receive timely medical treatment, they could not fight their beloved young daughter's illness.  From that moment on, Julio promised himself that he would never go through that same situation again and would better watch over his family's health.  Now he and his wife have another young daughter and she is the reason they are able to face bad situations together and, through their hard work, achieve the happiness that they seek.

Julio currently needs to buy a piece of equipment so that he can continue carrying out maintenance work in people's houses and start implementing some aspects of his fishing business.  He found out about Kiva loans and, without thinking twice, he requested a loan from our institution.  It will help him to increase his income and offer his family better living conditions.

Julio doesn't lose hope.  He continues to struggle and work hard, and tries to get over the sadness that he experienced with the death of his daughter.

loans.use: to buy machinery (a lawnmower)

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 22 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de ropa su historia comenzó cuando me quise separar y empecé a invertir mi poco capital en mercadería, su trabajo lo hace sola, si tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, está soltera, tiene 1 hijo de 1 año de edad, su sueño es tener un local propio o una boutique. 

Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de ropa (blusas y pantalones).
texts.en:
María is a 22 year old woman. She really aspires to prosper selling clothes in the next few years. Her story began when she wanted to separate and started to invest her small capital in merchandise. She works alone. She does have problems with crime. She is single and has a one year old son. Her dream is to have her own locale or a boutique. 

That's why she wants the loan to sell clothes (blouses and pants).

loans.use: clothes (blouses - pants)

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is 30 years old, married, and blessed with one child who is one and a half years old. For the past four years, he has owned a retail shop and he earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES. 

Silas is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase bundles of baking and maize flour, boxes of biscuits, cooking fat, and washing detergents. This is his first loan and he will use the profit to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, biscuits, cooking fat, and detergent

loans.name: Leonilyn

texts.en:
Leonilyn is 39 years old and is married with two children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past ten years, Leonilyn has run a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She is a new member of HSPFI.

Leonilyn is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Deysi Mariuxi

texts.es:
Deysi es una mujer de 25 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de recuerdos.

Su historia comenzó cuando escogió esta actividad ya que por la zona donde ella vive nadie se dedico a la elaboración de recuerdos empezó como algo rutinario que le resultaba ganancia se dedico a eso, su trabajo lo hace sola desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, no tiene dificultades, está soltera, tiene 1 hijo de 3 años de edad.

Su sueño es para su negocio que sigue prosperando y para su familia que  su desarrollen profesionalmente. Por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar recuerdos de porcelana y asi tener mas variedad.
texts.en:
Deysi is a 25 year old woman. She has many aspirations in the next few years to prosper with her keepsakes business.

Her story started when she chose this activity since no one in the area where she lives sold keepsakes. She started this as something routine that resulted in profits, so she dedicated herself to it. She works from eight in the morning until five in the evening. She does not have difficulties. She is single and has one son who is three years old.

Her dreams are that her business continues to prosper and that her family develops professionally. For this reason, she wants the loan to purchase porcelain keepsakes to have more variety.

loans.use: purchase porcelain keepsakes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La Sra. María es cliente nueva de la institución, tiene un  hijo que vive con ella, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo de reconocidas empresas a nivel internacional, también tiene una segunda actividad que es peinadora en un salón de peinados en la zona de Achumani donde también ofrece estos productos de belleza en su salón, le va muy bien con sus dos actividades, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de cosméticos que se encuentran en promoción  y así poder ofertar estos productos a sus clientas que van al salón y también entregar algunos pedidos que ella tiene y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: María is a new client to the institution. She has one son who lives with her. She sells beauty products via catalog from well known international brands; She also has a second activity, which is as a stylist in a hair salon in the Achumani area. She also sells her products in the hair salon. Her both activities are going well. At this time she is asking for the loan to buy cosmetics that are on sale. She can offer these products to her customers who go to the salon and also fill some orders that she has, thus increasing her working capital. She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support it has offered.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cosmetics.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 42 years old and is married with three children. For the past three years, he has run a pharmacy to earn a living. Philip describes his business environment as competitive as there are many people in the same business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income.

Philip is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to buy medicine to sell. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy medicine to sell

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng is 62 and has spent most of her life dedicated to rice farming. She is  from Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Seng is a single parent who has tried hard to raise her seven children since her husband passed away. Presently, three of her children are working in various careers to ensure a good living condition for the family. One of her children runs a used-clothing business and is able to earn around 10 USD daily at a market in Battambang province. 

Seng is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to buy more clothing and shoes for her daughter to sell as she has run out of stock. Seng will use her loan to maintain and improve her daughter's business. She is very appreciative of help from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Bissignon Group

texts.fr: BISSIGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Pascaline Médégnonmi(dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 38 ans. Pascaline Médégnonmi est mariée à un couturier du nom de Vidékon. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés. Pascaline Médégnonmi vit seule avec ses enfants. Pascaline Médégnonmi assure seule les diverses charges de la maison. Pascaline Médégnonmi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Pascaline Médégnonmi vend depuis une dizaine d’année, des cartes de recharges téléphoniques et des biscuits de façon secondaire à son domicile. Pascaline Médégnonmi s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue élargir son activité, Pascaline Médégnonmi sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe BISSIGNON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Bissignon is a group of three women, the members of which are friends and live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group's representative, Pascaline Médégnonmi (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 38 years old. Pascaline Médégnonmi is married to a dressmaker by the name of Vidékon. The couple has two children, both in school. Pascaline Médégnonmi lives alone with her children and sees to the various household expenses on her own. She did not attend school.

In order to meet her various expenses, Pascaline Médégnonmi has been reselling mobile phone top-up cards and cookies from her home for ten years. She gets her supplies in a region of Benin.

In hopes of satisfying her customers and expanding her business, Pascaline Médégnonmi is seeking a third loan from Alidé, along with the other members of the Bissignon Group. This loan will allow them to better respond to the needs of their customers and to make more of a profit. The first two loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phone top-up cards and boxes of cookies.

loans.name: Semaan

texts.en:
Semaan is a 40-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. The couple has three children who are all studying. Because of life expenses, Semaan has been obliged to work hard to fulfill his family's needs and pay his children’s educational fees. For the past 17 years, he has owned a vegetable shop. 

Semaan is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a pick-up truck  for his business which will allow him to better transport his products. In the future, he plans to have his own land to cultivate all kinds of vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase a truck for his business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 52 years old and is married to Edward. The couple is blessed with three children. For the past three years, Florence has been selling clothes along the busy Mlolongo highway in the area of Valley View. She earns 5,000 KES each month and has a good credit history.

Florence is requesting a 100,000 KES loan to buy clothing to sell. She will use her anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children. Florence is aggressive and hardworking and she hopes to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 

Francisca has a shop that sells rice per kilogram. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy sacks of rice to sell. Francisca is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Francisca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Besta

texts.en:
Besta lives in Yei. She sells at a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children; one of them is still in school. 

Besta heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Meruzhan

texts.en:
Meruzhan is 52 years old and lives in Tsakhkunk village, Sevan area, with his wife and only son. In the past he has worked as a locksmith and, since 2007, he has been a sexton. Meruzhan also is engaged in farming together with his wife and son. The family has a plot of land on which they grow and sell potatoes along with wheat that they use to bake bread for the family. They also breed cows, sheep, and goats and sell dairy products and meat.

Meruzhan is requesting a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy fodder for his livestock, potato seedlings, and fertilizer. This will be his second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy livestock fodder, potato seedlings, and fertilizer

loans.name: Rene Fernando

texts.es:
René es un hombre de 28 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su albañilería.

Su historia comenzó cuando su trabajo empezó a raíz de que sus padres lo enviaron a trabajar para sustentar el alimento en su familia, su trabajo lo hace solo todos los días de 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, no tiene dificultades, si está casado su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, si tiene 1 hijo de 2 años.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo y continuar trabajando para D-MIRO. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para comprar una moto y asi movilizarce a donde estan sus clientes.
texts.en:
René is a 28-year-old man who has a great desire to boost his building business over the next few years.

René started working when his parents sent him out to work to provide food for the family.  He works alone every day, from 7.00am to 5.00pm.  He does not experience any difficulties.  René is married and his wife takes care of their home.  They have one child who is 2 years old.

René's dream is to work hard so that he can own his own home.  He would also like to continue working with D-MIRO.  He would like a loan to buy a motorcycle so that he can travel to his customers.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 30 years old and is married with one child. She lives in the Philippines. For the past five years, she has run a food stall where she sells chicken barbecue and kebab hotdogs. Janeth is a new member of HSPFI.

Janeth is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP loan to buy raw ingredients for making barbecue and kebab hotdogs. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make barbecue and kebab hotdogs

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas de 36 años de edad casado con Fortunato de 41 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 5 hijos con los que viven en su casa propia ubicados en la comunidad de Periavente alta del distrito de Llochegua.
Felicitas es consecuente  con sus objetivos ella se dedica a la agricultura en la localidad de Periavente alta, donde cultiva cacao juntamente con su querido esposo y algunos peones que contrata. Ella se inicio en esta labor desde muy pequeña, pues sus padres le enseñaron a cultivar café. Desde entonces le gusto el trabajo en el campo, por lo que ahora pone en práctica en su actual actividad. Generalmente su producto lo vende en el distrito de Llochegua por que ahí le pagan un buen precio. En un futuro esta pensando seguir ampliando sus plantaciones de cacao. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.
Con los 2,500 nuevos soles contratará peones para que realicen el mantenimiento de su parcela de cacao.
texts.en:
Felicitas is 36 years old. She is married to Fortunato who is 41 years old. They have five children. The family lives in their own house located in the community of Periavente Alta in the Llochegua district. 
Felicitas is consistent with her objectives. She works in agriculture in Periavente Alta. She grows cacao with her loving husband and some contracted farm workers. She started doing this kind of work when she was very young. Her parents taught her how to grow coffee. Since then, she has liked working in the fields. For that reason, she is now putting this into practice with her own activity. Generally, she sells her product in the Llochegua district because there they pay a good price. In the future, she is thinking about continuing to expand her cacao plantations. This will be her second loan with MFP. She promises once again to make her payments on time. 
With the 2,500 nuevos soles, she will hire farm workers to do maintenance on her cacao plot.

loans.use: hire farm workers.

loans.name: Jonida

texts.en:
Jonida is 26 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family and has run a general store in the Philippines for the past 10 years. Jonida also earns an income from selling rice. She has borrowed and repaid six previous loans from NWTF.

Jonida is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more bread, canned goods and other items to sell in her general store. She hopes to save enough money to start a restaurant and coffee shop.

loans.use: to buy bread, canned goods, and other items to sell

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 28 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family and for the past three years has run a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. Sandra also earns an income from selling e-load cards and Avon products. 

Sandra is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy soft-drinks, canned goods, and other grocery items to sell. She has borrowed and repaid four previous loans from NWTF. In the future, Sandra aspires to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, canned goods, and grocery items to sell

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Aileen is forty-six years old and three of her children are in school.

Aileen has a business selling seafood in the Philippines. Aileen requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

Aileen has been in this business for seventeen years. In the future, Aileen would like to save money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

loans.name: Maria Nila

texts.en:
Maria Nila is twenty-two years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Maria Nila provides motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

Maria Nila is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Maria Nila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for her motorela services.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a thirty-four-year old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children who are all studying. Ali wishes to cover his family's expenses as best he can. Because of that, he’s working really hard, with the cooperation of his wife, to be able to reach his goals. He started his own business as a car mechanic in 2001 and has his own garage. In parallel, his wife has been working as a private teacher for eleven years. 

Today, he’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the mechanic tools he needs for his business. The loan will allow him to improve his work and therefore get a higher income. In the future, he plans to enlarge his garage and hire people to work with him.

loans.use: to purchase mechanic tools he needs for his business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is forty-five years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Gina makes and peddles snacks like tikoy and bitso-bitso (sweet rice cakes or balls). She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy the raw ingredients she needs to make snacks.

Gina is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients she needs to make snacks.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Roselyn requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and paint to repair her fishing boat. She has been in this business for fourteen years.

In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and paint to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Nyampurev

texts.en:
Nyampurev is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in the Hovd province of Western Mongolia. His wife is a teacher and his three kids study at the local secondary school. Nyampurev has been running a woodworking business since 2005 and he is currently selling his products at his local market. He bought a Bongo car with his profits. Nyampurev is a creative and clever man who says, "I would like to expand my business activities by getting the new types of supplies in large quantities based on my research and experience."

Nyampurev is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy timber and other materials to begin to make wooden furniture.

loans.use: to buy timber and materials to make wooden furniture

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith still owns the food market business she started six years ago. She earns a monthly income of 27,000 KES. This will be her second loan. 

Judith is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase the fruits, vegetables, cereals, and green grams required by her customers. She will use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals, fruits, and vegetables

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Rosie is making and peddling snacks like pancakes and hot cakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Rosie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rosie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Monday

texts.en:
Monday is 25 years old and married with two children. One of her children is still in school. Monday lives in Yei and has been running a food stall for the past two years. She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this will be her second loan.

Monday is requesting a loan of 700 SDG to purchase sugar and rice to sell. She will use the extra income from her loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and rice to sell

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Eufemia has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Eufemia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Eufemia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Saimon

texts.en:
Saimon is 42 years old and married with four children. He runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene 33 años de edad vive en la Comunidad 14 de Enero del Sindicato San Gabriel de las Sendas de la población del municipio de Chimoré provincia Carrasco de la ciudad de Cochabamba, el convive con la señora Mercedes junto a sus hijos, su principal actividad es la  agricultura y además es chofer.

Juan es una persona que desde niño tuvo que enfrentar la vida  trabajando a diario, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar  porque junto a sus hermanos salía al campo a trabajar en los terrenos agrícolas de su padre. En el transcurso del tiempo y con el arduo trabajo Juan fue aprendiendo que solo su esfuerzo haría alcanzar algunas metas que se trazaba, mientras Juan trabajaba arduamente en su actividad de transportista y agricultor sus hijos fueron creciendo y ahora se vio con más responsabilidades pues su trabajo diario solo le alcanzaba para comer. Actualmente ya cuenta con  dos terrenos agrícolas y que  pretende trabajarlas, ahora él solicita un crédito para la construcción de una piscina para la cría de peses que será el principio del desarrollo de una nueva actividad con lo cual tendrá  mayores ingresos y un mejor nivel de vida  junto a su familia.
Juan anhela que sus hijos tengan un futuro mejor que el que tuvo que peregrinar el, sacar a sus hijos del bachillerato y luego encaminarlos en estudios superiores serán su próxima meta y trabajara muy duro y hará lo posible para que esta situación se haga realidad y vea sus hijos en lo futuro con sus vidas más plenas y mejoradas.
texts.en:
Juan is 33 years old and lives in the community of "14th of January," located in the Syndicate of San Gabriel de las Sendas, municipality of Chimore, Carrasco province, in the City of Cochabamba. He lives with his wife Mercedes and their children. His principal activity is agriculture but, in addition, he is a chauffeur.

Juan is a person who since childhood, has had to confront life by working every day. He lacked the opportunity to study because, together with his brothers, he headed out to the fields to work his father's agricultural plots. With the passage of time, and with arduous labor, Juan learned that only his own efforts could lead him to achieve certain goals he had outlined. While Juan worked hard as a driver and farmer, his children were growing and now he has more responsibilities, because only through hard work can he provide their daily food. At present, he has 2 agricultural parcels that he cultivates. And now he is requesting a loan to construct a pool for raising fish, to begin developing a new activity from which more income can result, and a better standard of living for himself and his family. 

Juan hopes that his children will have a better future than he had to suffer through. Obtaining their high school diplomas and enrolling them in higher education will be his next goals. He will work very hard to make this achievable, so that he can see his children enjoy fuller and improved lives in the future.

loans.use: construct a pool for raising fish to sell.

loans.name: Naranhuu

texts.en:
Naranhuu is a 49-year-old man who lives with his wife and a son in Western Mongolia. His wife is unemployed, and the son studies at the local secondary school. 

He started his plumbing business in 2004. Over the years, he gained many customers. His work is very much appreciated among his customers. Now that demand for his services is increasing, he needs new efficient tools and raw materials. 

He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I am glad that my business is picking up. However, I need some support in order to meet my demand." He is requesting 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to buy plumbing materials.

loans.use: To buy plumbing materials.

loans.name: Auntie

texts.en: Auntie lives in Eguafo near Elmina, Ghana.  Her husband is retired and she has 7 dependents. Auntie operates a grocery shop, which she has done for 15 years now. Auntie uses her income to assist her husband with feeding and clothing their children.  Auntie will use her loan to purchase more groceries for sale.  With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for sale

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hairdresser and sells shoes and bags in Eguafo near Elmina. She is married to a farmer and has two children. Nancy has been a hairdresser for three years. She uses her income to support her husband in paying the accommodation bills. 

She will use her loan to purchase hair creams, mesh for hair, slippers and shoes for sale. With the new profit, Nancy plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair creams, mesh for hair, slippers and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Maria Del Socorro se dedica hacer arreglos y adornos para fiestas para toda ocasión. Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar el material que le esta haciendo falta y elaborar lo arreglos de varios pedidos que tiene pendientes para entregar. 
Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene Doña Maria Socorro para poder darle la educación necesaria a su hija quien estudia la segundaria, ya que es madre soltera y quiere un mejor futuro para ellas. 
Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio planea pagar el crédito ya que tiene en puertas varios eventos y hacer arreglos para el amor y la amistad y para el día de las madres aquí en México.
texts.en:
María del Socorro works making arrangements and decorations for parties for all occasions.  She is requesting a loan to buy the materials she needs and to make the arrangements for various pending requests.

This business is María Socorro's source of income to be able to give her daughter, who is in secondary school, the necessary education.  She is a single mother and wants a better future for both of them.  With the earnings she gets from her business she plans to pay back the loan because just around the corner she has various events and arrangements to make for Valentine's Day and Mother's Day here in Mexico.

loans.use: to buy materials to make the arrangements for social events.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married and has three children. She lives in the coastal town of Malindi, Kenya. She owns a charcoal shop which has been in operation for four years. She started it with her husband’s savings.

Regina joined Milango to access credit to finance her business operation. Her main challenges are high transport costs and capital to purchase her stock. She is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more sacks of charcoal. She dreams of opening other shops in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Otgon

texts.en: With this loan, Mrs. Otgon wanted to increase her business working capital to expand sales volume. The loan she is taking will be used to purchase more tools and hardware from her suppliers.

loans.use: To purchase more tools and hardware from her suppliers.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa sells maize at Eguafo near Elmina. She is divorced and has 7 dependents. As a single mother, she uses her income to feed, clothe and pay the school fees of her children. Theresa needs this loan to purchase bags of maize for sale. With the new profit, Theresa wishes to acquire large quantities of maize to distribute to retailers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for sale

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Saada is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has three children. Saada owns a hotel (a primitive restaurant), which has been in operation for four years. She learned of Milango from her friends; she then joined in order to access credit for her business.

Saada is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to purchase a freezer, a popcorn machine and some hotel stock. Her only challenge is the seasonal business environment.

She looks forward to setting up another restaurant in another strategic place in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer, a popcorn machine and some hotel (a primitive restaurant) stock.

loans.name: Adham

texts.en: Adham is a 21-year-old single man from Gaza. On June 1st, 2011, Adham opened his own computer and cell phone store. He hopes that with this loan he will be able to buy new phones and computers for his store. He believes this will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy new phones and computers for his store

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo es un padre de familia de 46 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos y vive junto a su esposa, la casa en la que actualmente vive es propia y esta ubicada  es un caserío Urbano Marginal, perteneciente al distrito de San José – Lambayeque, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, los habitantes de la zona se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura y ganadera exclusivamente.

Pablo se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo atrás a la crianza y posterior comercialización de ganado vacuno, caprinos, y aves de corral, en los mercados de la zona para lo que ya cuenta con clientes fijos quienes después de un determinado tiempo lo buscan para hacerle sus pedidos, adicionalmente a ese negocio Pablo también comercializa la leche que sus mismas vacas producen, negocio que lo administra su esposa quien junto a sus hijos salen a repartir de caserío en caserío.
 
Pablo desea invertir en al compra de animales (una vaca lechera) con la que aumentara su producción de leche diaria, para lo que cuenta con 80% del valor de la vaca que so producto de sus ahorros, esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto  de 2000 Nuevos Soles con los que completará para realizar su compra y así aumentar sus ingresos y hacer frente a sus responsabilidades.
texts.en:
Pablo is the 46-year-old father of a family. He has five children and lives with his wife. The house in which they now live is their own and is located in the village of Urbano Marginal, in the district of San José -- Lambayeque, an hour from the city of Chiclayo. The majority of the residents of this zone work exclusively in agriculture and livestock-raising.

Pablo has worked for a long time in raising and later selling cattle, goats and barnyard fowl in the area markets; for this he has regular customers who after a certain time look for him to place their orders. In addition to this business, Pablo also sells milk which his same cows produce, a business that is run by his wife, who goes out, along with their children, to sell it from village to village.
 
Pablo wants to invest in the purchase of animals (a milk cow), with which he will increase his daily production of milk; for this he has 80% of the cost of the cow in his savings. He is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 PEN, with which he will complete his purchase and thus increase his income and meet his responsibilities.

loans.use: to buy animals (milk cow), with which he will increase his production of milk.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 33-year-old single woman. She has two children who are 4 and 8 years old. She describes herself to be a team player and a mature and organized woman. 

She operates a beauty salon where she does ladies' hair, that is, hair blow-drying, plaiting, etc. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at an urban area, and her primary customers are women and young ladies. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be low turnout from customers for the services. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to purchase another dryer, weaves, hair oil and chemicals. Agnes'  business goal is to expand her beauty salon so as to provide services such as manicures, pedicures, etc., within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy another dryer, hair weaves and hair oil and chemicals.

loans.name: Gladi

texts.es: Gladi de 30 años de casado con Miqueas de 36 años, fruto de este gran amor tienen 04 hijos. Juntos viven en la comunidad de Periavente alta del distrito de Llochegua. Gladi es una joven madre llena de sueños y metas por alcanzar, ella se dedica al cultivo de café y cacao que a lado de su esposo, logran obtener una buena producción con el fin de mantener a su familia. Por otro lado, vende comida de manera ambulante, con la finalidad de que en el hogar nunca falte el pan de cada día y el amor en familia. Está orgullosa por su trabajo por que le es muy rentable gracias al apoyo de su esposo y algunos peones quienes le facilitan en la extracción de sus frutos. En un futuro Gladi desea adquirir un terreno para construir su vivienda. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles realizará la poda de sus plantaciones de caco y la limpieza de las malezas de su parcela de cacao, para ello contratará peones.
texts.en: Gladi, who is 30 years old, is married to Miqueas, who is 36, and from their great love they have four children. They live together in the community of Periavente Alta, in the district of Llochegua. Gladi is a young mother full of dreams and goals to achieve. Alongside her husband, she grows coffee and cacao, and they manage to obtain a good production with the goal of supporting their family. In addition, she sells food as a walking vendor, with the goal that in their household they never lack daily bread and love in the family. She is proud of her work because it is very profitable thanks to the support of her husband and a few workers who make the extraction of their fruits easier. In the future, Gladi wants to acquire land to construct their house. This will be her second loan with MFP, so she promises once again to make her payments punctually. The 3000 PEN will make possible the pruning of her cacao plantation and the cleaning of weeds from the cacao plot, because she will hire laborers for this.

loans.use: to hire workers

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is fifty years old, married and blessed with five children aged 26, 24, 22, 18 and 16. He has been in the Matatu (a Public Service Vehicle - or minibus) business for fifteen years and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

He is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase an engine for his Public Service Vehicle. His profit will help him repay his loan. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase an engine.

loans.name: Wilkister

texts.en:
Wilkister is 44 years old. She is married to Haron and blessed with four children. She has done farming for the past 11 years and gets an income of 15,200 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

She has a good credit history with KADET  LTD. She is applying for her fourth loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD; she plans to buy a dairy cow for improving her farming. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees.

She hopes to complete her house, educate all her children to the tertiary level, improve the farming and keep high-breed cattle.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to improve her farming.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a thirty-eight-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from one to four years old. She describes herself as a social and talkative woman. She operates a retail shop where she sells home products such as sugar, salt, sodas, loaves of bread, maize flour etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are regulars as well as walk-ins. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the retail business. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more wheat flour and rice to sell. Eunice's business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and flour to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is thirty-five years old, married to Isaac and blessed with three children aged twelve, ten and four. She sells sweet potatoes, a business she started three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 5,000. 

She has requested a loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase sweet potatoes to sell. The profit made will help her pay school fees for her children. She hopes to live a better life. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a twenty-two-year-old single man, from Gaza. On January 8th, 2011, he opened his own barber shop. He hopes that through this loan he will be able to expand the size of his shop. He believes that once he expands the size of his shop, this will bring in more customers.

loans.use: to expand the size of his shop.

loans.name: Jacklin

texts.en:
Jacklin lives in Yei. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for four years. She is 30 years old, married and has two children; one child is in school. 

Jacklin heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer; this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 Sudan pounds in order to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Topoika

texts.en:
Topoika is 39 years old, married and a father of six children. He is a wheat farmer and has been in this business for the last nine years with a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan shillings. 

He has applied for his third loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase inputs to prepare and cultivate his farm.

He hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest in it. His future dreams are to improve the family's living standards and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs to prepare and cultivate his farm.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick, a 28-year-old man from Kisumu City, situated in the Western part of Kenya, is married to Joyce, and they have a one-year-old child. For the past six years Fredrick has been operating a clothing business mainly offering men's shirts for sale, earning a monthly income of KES. 19,000.

Now requesting his first loan from KADET LTD to buy three bales of men's shirts, he will use the profits to grow his business. Fredrick's dream is to stabilize his income and support his family.

loans.use: to buy three bales of men's shirts for resale.

loans.name: Nelly Rogelia

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer de 35 años, se describe como una persona muy estricta, seria y responsable en las actividades que realiza. Nelly vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en la ciudad de Latacunga, en la Provincia de Cotopaxi.

Nelly trabaja sola en la crianza de pollos blancos, es el primer crédito que realiza en Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de pollos blancos y balanceado para su alimentación, que permitirá que sus pollos engorden y que sean de buena calidad al momento de venderlos. Esta inversión permitirá a Nelly incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos que ayudaran a sustentar los gastos de su casa.

El sueño de Nelly es prosperar economicamente con su familia para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nelly is a 35-year-old woman who describes herself as a very strict, serious, and responsible person in the activities she does.  Nelly lives with her husband and three children in the city of Latacunga, in Cotopaxi Province.

Nelly works alone raising white chickens.  This is the first loan she is getting from FODEMI, and she will use it to buy white chickens and balanced feed for their diet, which will allow her chickens to fatten and be of good quality at the time of sale.

This investment will allow Nelly to increase her sales and her income, which will help support her household expenses.  Nelly's dream is to prosper financially with her family, to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy white chickens and balanced feed to feed her animals.

loans.name: Mwangamgi

texts.en:
Mwangamgi is a 32-year-old married man. His wife is a farmer. He has three children with ages ranging from 9 months to 7 years. He describes himself as someone who likes sharing ideas and as a quiet man. 

He operates a general store where he sells school uniforms, wallets, radios, socks, hats, etc. He has been involved in this business for four years and employs one staff member. His business is located at an urban area, and his primary customers are passersby. 

In addition to the store, he works as a plumber to increase his income. He describes his biggest business challenge to be frequent disturbances by the city council. 

He will use the 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to purchase more school uniforms for selling. Mwangamgi's business goal is to venture into a new business of manufacturing items made of metal within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children.

loans.use: to buy additional school uniforms for selling.

loans.name: Mayamou

texts.en: Mayamou is 45 years old and lives in Jacobs Town. She is married and has four children ages 3 to 27 years old. For fifteen years now, Mayamou has been selling lappa (traditional cloth) in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother, and learned this way of selling from her mother. She likes her business because of the saving she makes  every day.  She says selling things that she likes makes her proud of her business. Mayamou is requesting a loan to purchase more lappa (traditional cloth) for her business.  Her plans is to build a store for her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa (traditional cloth) for her business

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua  is a single parent with 4 children.  Efua cooks kenkey (fermented corn dough) for sale. On her lap in the picture are the leaves which she uses to cover the  maize dough in the kenkey preparation.  Efua has been in this business for 20 years. Efua will use her loan to purchase maize in large quantities to enable her to produce more kenkey for sale.

loans.use: To purchase maize in large quantities to enable her to produce more kenkey for sale

loans.name: Maripet

texts.en:
Maripet is 27 years old, married, and a father of five children. He is a maize farmer and has been in the business for the last five years gaining a monthly income of  KES 17,000. 

He is applying for his first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD and this will assist him to hire a tractor for land preparation and to buy farm inputs.

Maripet hopes to use the profits to diversify into sheep farming. His future dreams is to venture into large scale farming.

loans.use: to hire a tractor for land preparation and to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Rahif

texts.en: Rahif is a 56-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-age children. He has big responsibilities toward his family especially his children. He has been working as a truck driver in a local company since 1995. Today, he wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his children’s study fees. He will be more than happy to see them achieving higher positions. In the future he plans to take more Kiva loans to continue covering his children’s educational fees.

loans.use: to pay his children’s study fees

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi is 55 and divorced. She has two children and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

For the past five years, she has run a food stall to cover the family's living expenses. She sells beverages, cigarettes and confectionery to people in her community. The business is going smoothly, and she would like a loan to buy new furniture, coffee and beverages to provide to her customers.

She hopes this will increase her income, help her to improve her living conditions and allow her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy new furniture, coffee and beverages to provide to her customers.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is 28 years old, married and blessed with two children ages 10 and 8. She has been selling fish for the past five years and earns a monthly income of KES 9,000.

Lillian has requested for a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more fish for sale. Her increased profits will help her expand her business to other towns. Her dream is to buy a plot of land. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Mutunga

texts.en:
Mutunga is a married man who has a three-year-old daughter. He describes himself to be a social and risk-taking man.

Mutunga operates a retail business where he sells furniture such as beds, mattresses, and chairs. He has had this business for two years, and it is located at a busy area where his primary customers are middle-income earners.

Mutunga says his biggest business challenge is not having access to enough wood. He will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more wood. His business goal is to expand his furniture making business and move his business to a new location within five years.

loans.use: to buy more wood for making furniture

loans.name: Tsetseg-Ulzii

texts.en:
Tsetseg-Ulzii is a 53-year-old widow who lives with her 29-year-old daughter in a ger, a Mongolian traditional felt tent, in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia.

Since 2006, she has been operating her own fast food service business. Her business is located in the heart of the city, so she attracts many customers. She has one employee.

Tsetseg-Ulzii is asking for a loan to renovate the outside of her fast food business.  In the future, she plans to improve her business in order to create good working conditions.

loans.use: to do some renovation work on the outside section of her fast food business

loans.name: Giao

texts.en:
Giao is a 35-year-old married woman who lives with her husband in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works at a private company.  She has helped support her family by making clothes for five years.

Giao plans to use the proceeds of this loan to expand her business by purchasing a greater quantity and quality of fabric and materials to make better clothes.  She hopes that this will enable her to attract new customers, increase the turnover of her business, and earn a higher income with which to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and other sewing materials

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 36 years old, married, and is blessed with three children aged nine, eight, and five years old. She started a dairy farming business two years ago and now earns a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

This 30,000 KES loan is Rachel's first, which she plans to use to purchase another cow. She wants to use the extra profit she anticipates making from the new cow to buy more chicks to rear and sell. She hopes to be prosperous in life.

loans.use: to buy another cow

loans.name: Aloto Alomin 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALOTO ALOMIN 1 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et ont des liens de parenté. C'est la troisième  fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Laure est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Laure est âgée de 46 ans et vit au Bénin. Laure n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Laure est mariée à un certain Jules et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. En dehors des quatre enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Le couple supporte ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Laure  mène comme activité la vente de céréales et de charbon de bois de façon secondaire, à son domicile. Laure achète ses produits au Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus lui permettant de subvenir à ses besoins et de contribuer aux dépenses du ménage. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Laure sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALOTO ALOMIN 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Aloto Alomin 1 Group is made up of three women who live in the same neighborhood and share family ties. This is the third time that this group is seeking financial assistance from Alidé in order to increase their business.

The group's representative, named Laure, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. Laure is 46 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. Laure is married to a man named Jules and is the mother of four children, all of them attending school. In addition to these four children, the couple is responsible for another child. The couple bears the various expenses of the family together.

For some ten years, Laure has been in business reselling grains and charcoal from her home. Laure purchases her wares in Benin. This business generates enough income to allow her to meet her needs and to contribute to the household expenses.

In the hope of satisfying her customers and increasing her sales figures and her income, Laure, along with the other members of the Aloto Alomin 1 Group, is seeking a third loan from Alidé. The two previous loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: To purchase grains (corn, millet) and bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Henny

texts.en:
Henny is a 38-year-old lady, married and blessed with five children: Roberto, 18, Revanny, 17, attending Senior High School grades 3 and 2; Roy, 15, attending Junior High School, grade 3; Teguh, 13 and Tiar, 10 both attending elementary school. 

Henny runs a kiosk business at home. She has been running the business for four years. She sells daily basic necessities, i.e., sugar, bath soap, cooking ingredients, instant noodles, cigarettes, and some snacks. The income from her business enables her to assist her husband in covering their household needs and school fees of her children. 

Recently, Henny was thinking to improve the business. She intends to complete her kiosk business inventory with cakes, mobile phone recharges, petrol and other necessities. Henny is sure the more complete the stock at her kiosk, the more income she can earn. Therefore she is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,500,000. She is hoping that TLM will provide her with the loan shortly.

loans.use: to purchase cakes, mobile phone recharges, petrol and other necessities.

loans.name: Twisungane/ Rhng Mrm Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel  fait partie du groupe Twisungane/Rhng Mrm. Il a 42 ans et il est marié, avec 4 enfants de 6 à 16 ans  dont 3 scolarisés. Il a 6 personnes dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.

Emmanuel est commerçant. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants pour son agriculture des tomates.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’augmenter son capital pour agrandir son projet d’agriculture en faisant l’agriculture moderne. Dans les prochaines années, Emmanuel voudrait être le grand distributeur des tomates. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser et soigner ses enfants.il fait aussi l’élevage des chèvres.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is part of the Twisungane/Rhng Mrm. Group. He is 42 years old and is married with four children, aged six to 16 years, three of whom attend school. He is responsible for six people, aside from his children. His level of education is three years of high school.

Emmanuel is a trader. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to purchase fertilizers for his tomato crop.

His strategy for growing his business is to increase his capital in order to expand his farming enterprise by using modern farming. In the coming years, Emmanuel would like to be the major supplier of tomatoes. With the profits, he intends to send his children to school and to take care of them. He also raises goats.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for his tomato crop.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 42 years old, a modest lady from Homabay town, West of Kenya. She is married to Charles and they have four children aged between 10 and 23 years.

Pamela operates a shoe selling business, a business she has been doing for the last 15 years, and makes a monthly income of KES 15,000. She is taking out her fourth loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy a stock of new shoes for sale. 

She will use her profits to educate  her children and also expand business. Her dream is to have a better life now and in the future.

loans.use: To buy a stock of new shoes for sale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 52 years old, married and blessed with four children aged 24, 22, 18 and 14 years. She owns a bar and restaurant businesses she started five years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. She has applied for a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase soft drinks and alcoholic beverages for sale. 

The profit she makes will be ploughed back into her business and apart of it used to pay school fees. Her dream is to open other branches of her business in various towns. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and alcoholic beverages for sale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 42-year-old lady from Homabay town, Western Kenya, and is married to Jephason. They have children aged from seven to 21 years.

Beatrice operates a beauty salon and has been doing this for the last 11 years, making a monthly income of KES 12,500. She is taking out her fourth loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy a stock of beauty products (cosmetics). She will use her profits to educate her children.

Her dream is to have a big beauty salon in Homabay.

loans.use: To buy a stock of cosmetics for sale in her salon

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 52 years old, married to Francis, and is blessed with two children. She sells clothes, a business she started 14 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 50,000. She has requested a loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase ladies' skirts, suits, trousers and jeans. 

Profit made will help her build more rental houses in her plot. Her dream is to become more stable in life. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase ladies' skirts, suits, trousers and jeans.

loans.name: Emilly

texts.en:
Emilly is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has two children. Emilly owns a café that has been in operation for three years. She saved the money from a casino and managed to start the business.

Emilly is applying for a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to pay for her children’s school fees.

Her future ambition is to grow the café to a better enterprise.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en:
Japheth is 32 years of age. He is married to Linet and blessed with two children, aged 6 years and 1 year respectively. He sells clothes, a business he started 11 years ago, and earns a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).  

He has requested a loan worth KES 30,000 to buy trousers, skirts and shirts for sale. The profit will help him buy more stock for his business. His dream is to become successful. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To buy trousers, skirts and shirts for sale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is a fishmonger in Eguafo near Elmina. She buys the fish from the market and fries it for sale. Esi has been into this business for 15 years now. 

She is married to a farmer and has six dependents. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase more fish to fry for sale. With the new profit, Esi wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 28 years old, a mother of five children aged 13, 10, seven, six years and seven months. She has been selling fish for the past 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES 12,000. She has requested a loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase more fish for sale. 

The profit she makes will help her pay school fees for her children. She hopes to live a better life, and this is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita  produces "kenkey" for sale. In front of Rita in the photo is the maize dough she uses in her "kenkey" production. She is married to a farmer and has five children. She uses her income to help her husband in the general up-keep of the family. Rita needs this loan to purchase bags of maize for her "kenkey" production. With the new profit, Rita will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for her "kenkey" (fermented maize dough) production

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Forty-eight years old, Salina is married to Nathan and is blessed with five children aged 17, 11, nine, seven and three years. She has a retail shop, a business she started five years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 8,000. 

She has requested a loan worth KES 20,000 to purchase bars of soap, packets of sugar, salt and baking flour. 

The profit earned from the business will help her expand her shop. Her dream is to expand her business, and this is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase bars of soap, packets of sugar, salt and baking flour.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 35 years old, a single mother blessed with two children aged 14 and 11 years. She sells used clothes, a business she ventured into five years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 30,000, which she will use to purchase bales of used clothes for sale. The profit she earns from this business would help her buy a plot of land and develop it. 

Her dream is to have a better life in future. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase bales of used clothes for sale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old, married to Thomas, and blessed with four children with the eldest being 18 years old and the youngest being two years old. She owns a "posho" (cornmeal) mill, a business she started 12 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to purchase bags of maize to stock in her "posho" mill. Her profit will be ploughed back into her business. She hopes to be successful in her business. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize to stock in her "posho" (cornmeal) mill.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 45-year-old man from Kisumu City, Western Kenya. He is married to Lilian, and they two children, aged 10 and 18 years old.

Joseph has been selling clothes for the last 11 years and makes a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to add more stock of ladies and gents clothing, belts and traveling bags.

He will use the profits to expand his business. His dream is to supply clothing on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: To buy ladies and gents clothing, belts and traveling bags.

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es: La Sra. Zenobia  tiene 58 años y es separada con 2 hijos que son mayores ya que tienen la edad de 25 y 30 años, ella vende en su tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la zona Sopocachi. Este préstamo es el primero que tiene con la Institución,  la Sra.  Zenobia va a usar este préstamo para compra de varios productos, como  refrescos galletas  por cantidad para surtir  su negocio, y así de esta manera es incrementar su capital en las fiestas de carnavales. La Sra. Zenobia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia de otras tiendas. Ella va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de  mercadería la Sra. Zenobia  sueña con  ampliar su negocio, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Zenobia, 58, is separated with two adult children, ages 25 and 30.  She sells in her neighborhood store in the Sopocachi area.

This loan is her first with the institution.  Zenobia is going to use this loan to buy large quantities of various products such as soft drinks and cookies to supply her business.  In this way she will increase her capital in the Carnival parties.  Zenobia does face challenges in her business, which is competition with other stores.  She is going to use the profits for buying merchandise.

Zenobia dreams about expanding her business.  She is happy with and grateful to the institution for the support given.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and a variety of products for her neighborhood store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to begin a construction project on her house

loans.name: Ximena Carola

texts.es: La señora Ximena vive en zona de chasquipampa  la señora se dedica a la artesanía desde hace años elabora juegos de bisutería en piedras preciosas como ser piedras cuarzo, cascajo, perlas, etc…un juego compone de cuatro piezas un collar, una manilla y un par de aretes, también da clases particulares a domicilio donde vende el material además que cobra por hora avanzada, la señora es divorciada y tiene dos hijas en edad escolar las cuales  la ayudan ya en la elaboración. Por otro lado también hace la elaboración de tortas a la semana siempre tiene por lo mínimo un pedido, el préstamo que solicita lo tiene destinado para la compra de material ya que tiene una fuerte cantidad de pedido para carnavales para un comparsa y también aumenta la demanda de pedidos en esas fechas, motivo por el cual se solicita el financiamiento Kiva.
texts.en: Ximena lives in the Chasquipampa neighborhood.  She has been working in handicrafts for years, making jewelry sets from precious stones such as pieces of quartz, stones, pearls, etc.  A set consists of 4 pieces, including: a necklace, a bracelet and a pair of earrings. In addition, she gives private lessons from her home where she sells the materials and also charges by the hour.  Ximena is divorced and has two school-aged daughters who help her make the jewelry.  In addition, she makes cakes during the week, for which she always has at least one order.  She will use this loan that she is requesting to buy supplies, because she has a large number of orders from a dance troupe that will participate in upcoming carnivals. Also, she anticipates that her orders will increase during this time, and so this is the reason that she is requesting financing from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make jewelry (stones, quartz, pearls, etc.)

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 24 years old and single. She has operated her beauty salon business in Nakuru town for the last 3 years and the business is doing well.

She was introduced to KADET LTD. by one of our existing clients and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of cosmetics for use and sale in her beauty salon.

In future, Ruth hopes to grow her business and open a big cosmetics shop, hence making more profit and thereby improving her living standards.

loans.use: to add more stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Jose Maximo

texts.es:
José  es un hombre de 58 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su albañilería.

Su historia comenzó desde pequeño su padre le enseño la actividad y asi decidió seguir con este profesión, realiza los contactos y así consigue los trabajos, no tiene dificultades, si está casado su esposa es ama de casa y de vez en cuando vende en el mercado, si tiene hijos son mayores de edad.

Su sueño es que su familia se supere y así poderle dar un futuro bueno a ellos. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para comprar cemento, arena, metal.
texts.en:
José is a 58-year-old man who has a great desire to boost his building business over the next few years.

José started out in this trade when he was young and his dad taught him the business.  He decided to continue working in the profession.  He creates contacts and this is how he gets jobs.  He does not experience any difficulties.  José is married.  His wife looks after their home and occasionally sells products in the market.  They have children who are now adults.

José's dream is for his family to do well so that he can give them a good future.  He would like this loan to buy cement, sand and metal.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and metal

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 35 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de mariscos. 

Su historia comenzó cuando es un negocio que viene desde el papa más de 30 años y el decidió ser independiente hace 15 años, su trabajo lo hace solo todos los días el compra marisco en el puerto de santa rosa y vende en Daule, no tiene dificultades, si está casado su esposa se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante, si tiene 4 hijos 3 estudian en escuela fiscal.

Su sueño es entregar al por mayor el marisco a hoteles. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de mariscos como camarones, pescados, cangrejos.
texts.en:
Luis is a 35-year-old man who has a great desire to boost his seafood business over the next few years.
